loans.use: to purchase materials to make votive objects to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be a caring woman. She operates a retail store where she sells beauty products. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate clean water for her family. She will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank for her five family members. Her business goal is to improve her retail business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standard of her family. Previously, she had taken a loan of KES 100,000, which she managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Daniel Jose

texts.es:
Daniel  21 años edad, soltero, de oficio comerciante, el se dedica a la fabrica y  venta de bolis, con conocimiento académico de sexto grado, padre de 2 hijos. Él dice que el negocio era de su papa, pero él le ayudaba con  la venta de bolis, después el decidió comprarle  el negocio a su papa,  a la edad de 19 años para seguir trabajando por si solo, ya que este ha sido su único negocio, en el que espera tener mejores ingresos y asi poder tener el sustento de su familia, ya que  el comercializa sus productos en la comunidades   Dalia y Jalapa, y de esta manera  a el  le gustaría ampliar sus productos en  los supermercados. Sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio para ofrecer un producto de consumo  mejor a sus clientes  y tener una mejor presentación en su negocio.
Daniel solicita el crédito para comprar toda la materia prima que necesita como  bolsas plásticas para empacar, azúcar, colorante, etc. ya que el estima que con este préstamo podrá comprar todos los productos para la elaboración de sus bolis y poder surtir más su negocio, sus planes futuros es poder  ampliar sus y sus metas es poder tener mas ingreso para invertir en su negocio y poder cumplir  su sueño de tener mas grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Daniel is 21 years old, single, a merchant, and works making and selling popsicles. He has a 6th grade education and is the father of 2 children. He says that the business was his father’s but he helped him selling popsicles and later he decided to buy the business from his father, at the age of 19 in order to continue working by himself. As this has been his only business, he hopes to have increased earnings and thus to be able to sustain his family. He sells his products in the communities of Dalia and Jalapa, and along these lines, he would like to expand his products to the supermarkets. His expectation is to continue expanding his business in order to offer a better consumer product to his customer and to make more of an impact in his business.

Daniel is asking for a loan in order to buy raw materials that he needs such as plastic bags for packaging, sugar, food coloring, etc, since he thinks that with this loan he will be able to buy all the products for the preparation of his popsicles and to be able to better stock his business. His future plan is to be able to expand and his dream is to be able to have more income in order to invest in his business and to be able to fulfill his dream of having a larger business.

loans.use: to buy all the raw materials he needs such as plastic bags for packaging, sugar, food coloring, etc. for his popsicle business

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Bhodebi is an active married lady who is 25 years old and a permanent resident of a rural village called Luthurbandh in Titilagarh block of Boalngir district of Odisha, India. Bolangir district is one of the underdeveloped areas of Odisha with 80% rural population. The young lady sitting in the first row with her hand raised is Bhodebi. She resides with her husband, two sons who are four and two years old, and her father and mother in-law. To increase the income of her family, in the year 2010, Bhodebi, along with four like-minded women of her village formed a group named Maha Laxmi and received a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.
 
Bhodebi and her husband run two businesses. Her husband manages a betel nut shop in the market area of her village and Bhodebi runs a general fancy store with fancy items like bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments etc. in her house. Prior to this business, Bhodebi’s husband was running a well-established general store in the market yard. But due to jealousness of some of the vested interest people in her village, her husband was forced to close the business. During that period, her family was leading a very pitiful life due to acute financial problems. This situation compelled her to find ways and means to maintain her family. So Bhodebi, in consultation with her husband, mortgaged her gold ornaments for 10,000 INR and started the fancy store with a low profile. Now her fancy store is running well. Bhodebi brings stock from different towns.  Presently, she is selling fancy items worth 300 INR to 500 INR per day from which she gets 15 to 20% profit. From this small income, she barely manages her family's expenses. So she wants to increase the volume of her business to increase the income. From this loan of 10,000 INR, Bhodebi wants to invest the entire amount to purchase different varieties of bangles

Bhodebi is confident enough to have a business of her own and hopes to give a better education to her two sons.

The other four energetic group members are Manjulata, Bhubaneswari, Bhaktilata and Puspanjali who are running a stationary store, and egg center, a footwear center and a puffed rice business, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase bangles

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en: Mourine is a 36-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, tea leaves, maize flour, etc. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for her eight family members to use. She will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her eight family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Almajd Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Majd, and it comprises four ladies. They applied for a loan of 250000 YER. 

Latifa, one of the ladies, lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is 38 years old. 

She has been operating a small grocery store for two years. She started her business with a small amount of capital.

She is applying for a loan of 70000 YER to buy grocery items like canned food and soft drinks for her business. She hopes to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned food and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en: Rosebella is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 2 children who are 2 and 7 years old. She describes herself as a focused risk-taker. She operates a farm where she sells farm produce such as maize, beans and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile agricultural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient water for home use in household chores. She will use the 8700 KES loan to buy a water tank, which her five family members will use to complete their household chores. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 53-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her locality. This is the source of her income. 

Alicia is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for cooking, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, and margarine. Through this, she will be able to enhance her sales and profit.

In the future, Alicia dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for cooking, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, and margarine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Aubrey Marie

texts.en:
Aubrey Marie runs a variety store in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 24 years old and the mother of two young children. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She works hard to earn a living to help her husband meet the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her children.

Aubrey Marie is requesting a loan to buy toys, ladies' accessories, home and school supplies, and other items to sell in her store. With this loan, she will be able to improve her selection and attract more customers, thus increasing her sales and profit.

In the future, Aubrey Marie hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy toys, ladies' accessories, home and school supplies, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Daniel Omar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SR DE LOS TEMBLORES III,el socio continua trabajando en un restaurante turistico elaborando diferentes tipos de platos como internacionales y  nacionales,el socio a la vez continua con su negocio de venta de artesania ,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio de igual forma sigue apoyando a su hermana en su nuevo negocio de restaurante el cual le esta llendo bien,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante. 
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio de artesania como chompas de alpaca.
EL socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Sr. de Los Temblores III”. He continues to work at a tourist restaurant where he prepares different types of international and local dishes. At the same time, he continues his business of selling handicrafts. He has done well in his business thanks to the effort he puts forth each day. The borrower continues to help his sister in her new restaurant business that is also doing well. He is a responsible and industrious individual who seeks to get ahead by working in this manner.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy merchandise, such as alpaca sweaters, to sell in his craft business. The borrower is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
Ricardo José es profesor, tiene trece años de laborar, es soltero, vive en casa de su madre.

Tiene un molino donde procesa el maíz para elaborar tortillas, nacatamales, cosas de horno(Rosquillas), todos estos productos fabricados del maíz, popular en la comida de los nicaragüenses.

El dinero lo solicita para mejorar el local donde tiene el molino y así prestar un buen servicio a su clientela.

Gracias a ceprodel y kiva tiene este pequeño negocio porque con créditos que se le ha otorgado obtuvo este equipo. Le ha ayudado de mucho por que su mama atiende esta actividad por lo que ella pasa todo el día en casa.
texts.en:
Ricardo José is a teacher.  He has done this work for 3 years.  He is single and lives in his mother's house.  

He has a mill that processes corn to make tortillas, nacatamales (a steamed meat and vegetable pasty cooked in banana or maize leaves), and baked goods (donuts).  All of these items are made of corn and are popular foods in Nicaragua.  

He is requesting this loan to make improvements to the site where he has the mill so that he can provide a good service to his customers.

He has this small business thanks to Ceprodel and Kiva because he has been able to obtain the equipment with his loans.  This has helped him a lot because his mother attends to the business since she spends all day at home.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and stone blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Thi

texts.en: Thi is requesting a new loan to buy sewing materials to make clothes for her customers. Thi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials to make clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Gion

texts.en:
Gion is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as food and beverages, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Gilbert Gbenassou

texts.fr: Gilbert Gbenassou est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Gilbert Gbenassou est marié à une marchande du nom de Béatrice. Gilbert Gbenassou est père de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Gilbert Gbenassou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants, le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de leurs enfants. Afin d’assurer ses diverses charges, Gilbert Gbenassou mène comme activité, le métier de meunier depuis quinze ans à son domicile. Gilbert Gbenassou désire acquérir un moulin à maïs pour renforcer ses équipements. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Gilbert Gbenassou sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gilbert Gbenassou, age 47, lives in Benin and is married to a merchant named Beatrice. He is the father of three children, some of whom have received schooling. He lives with his wife and children, and the couple provide together for the children’s various needs. 

In order to support the household, Gilbert Gbenassou has been working as a miller from his home for the past fifteen years. He would like to upgrade his equipment by acquiring a maize mill. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase his sales and revenue, Gilbert Gbenassou is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé. This credit will help him to bolster his activity, which should result in a boost in profits. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy a maize mill.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a lady who has good references from her neighbors — she is very respectful and hardworking. She has a great desire to succeed and live well with her husband. Jane has been operating a grocery store for some time, which she still operates and keeps up-to-date. She is also in the teaching profession, but she operates her grocery store in the afternoons. Her pupils like her because of her kind and caring nature.

She says that a disaster has befallen her in the last few weeks. One of her houses caught on fire and it consumed most of her valuables. She wants to reconstruct her house, but she does not have money to do so. This is the reason she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like cement, timber and iron sheets among others. She hopes to continue to be in business, so she can provide what her family will require.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, timber, and iron sheets among others.

loans.name: Maa Ram Chandi Group

texts.en:
Puspanjali who is about 46 is standing on the extreme left with her hand raised in the photo. She is an active member of a JLG named Maa Ram Chandi located in Muniguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. Muniguda is a small town bordered by a green forest, a mountain range and one river. Maa Ram Cchandi group consists of four energetic women who are running some businesses for the financial upliftment of their families.

Puspanjali resides with her husband, one daughter aged 23 and one son aged 18 who are studying in college. She runs a small general store at Muniguda with the help of her husband. She sells rice, sugar, potatoes, oil, soap, toothpaste, etc. She also makes leaf plates with her daughter to add some supplementary income to her family. Puspanjali earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR from the existing businesses, but as the maintenance cost has increased, the present income is not sufficient for her to manage the family. Previously, her group has already taken three loans from Mahashakti Foundation and repaid the entire loans on time. This time, she plans to use the loan for the purpose of including more spices items and stationary items like notebooks, pencils, pens, and compasses for students in her general shop. She hopes this will generate more income for her family. Puspanjali hopes to see her daughter as a nurse and her son as a police inspector and get them married into a well-reputed family.

The other three members of the group are Somarani, Papidei and Rangabati who run a Tiffin hotel, sell leaf plates at wholesale and run a barbershop.

loans.use: To purchase notebooks, compasses, pens, pencils, etc

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon would like to take a further loan to buy a washing machine to expand her laundry business. Her previous loan enabled her to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and attract new customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her laundry business.

loans.name: Tuoi

texts.en: Tuoi would like to take a further loan to buy rice and raw food to make meals for sale. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice and raw food to make meals for sale.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en: Teofilo is a 61-year-old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transportation business for several years now. He transports passengers going from one place to another. He also owns a farm and grows different kinds of crops like rice and banana. Teofilo is asking for a loan to buy gasoline for the motorcycle and fertilizer for the crops. In the future, Teofilo hopes to make his business a success and save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the motorcycle and fertilizer for the crops

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be would like to take a further loan to buy coffee and a variety of soft drinks to sell from her shop. Be's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee and a variety of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Memuna.  She is married and has 3 children aged 18, 15, and 11. In 2007, she established her timber business to enhance her independence, and it is now one of her sources of income. Her customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 750,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Memuna has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more timber. She hopes that this loan will enable her to buy even more stock. In the future, she plans to own a timber processing business, to educate her children and to own a house. She appreciates the support she is receiving from kiva.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van would like to take a further loan to buy more bread to sell at her food stall. Van's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen would like to take a further loan to buy coffee and many other kinds of beverages to sell at her food stall. Huyen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee and many other kinds of beverages to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Deidra

texts.en: In her hometown of Houston, Texas, Deidra runs Tropical Express, a shaved ice shop. “I’ve been trying to be an entrepreneur for about eight years,” she says. “It just hasn’t happened because I haven’t been able to purchase the equipment.” She first visited ACCION Texas Inc. five years ago. While trying to start her business, Deidra went to Small Business Administration, where she learned about ACCION Texas. From there, she was inspired to invest some of her money to open the store, which currently carries 14 flavors and will sell 100 flavors by April, when the warm weather returns. Though shaved ice is a seasonal item, Deidra operates year-round by also selling hot dogs and nachos. Deidra started her business in her grandmother’s backyard. “I did so well, but it got to be too much with the heat, so I stopped.” After taking a business class and seeing the need for a shaved ice store within her area, Deidra decided to return to work. Tropical Express is “really the only shop in the area with shaved ice,” Deidra says. The shop operates with a three-member team, working and volunteering to help keep the start-up costs down. Deidra needs extra help now, but plans to postpone the hiring process until the summer. She plans to hire high school and college students. The ACCION loan supplied Deidra with hot dog cookers, syrup containers and a large cooler. Without the help of ACCION, Deidra says, “I’d probably still be sweating and trying to start up. I really appreciate ACCION helping me and being patient with me while working through the loan process.”

loans.use: to pay for kitchen supplies and start-up costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Majd

texts.en: Majd is a 30-year-old married man who has two children and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has had a bus for four years. He saved a small amount of money and borrowed additional money from his relatives to buy the bus. He has been offering bus transportation services to and from his city for some time now, and his work has kept him increasingly busy. He applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new beverages to restock her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen would like to take another loan to buy more kinds of food and ingredients in order to make better food to sell from her stall. Yen's previous loan enabled her to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and attracting new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of food and ingredients to make better food to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy more spare parts and equipment to sell from her store. Thuy's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts and equipment to sell from her store.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Nhung's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing tools, equipment and materials.

loans.name: Byron Jose

texts.es: Byron  originario de la Comarca  Rio Abajo, pueblo nuevo,  Municipio de Estelí,  35 años de edad, padre de 2 hijos, de oficio agricultor. Inicio desde muy joven  en la agricultura  en la siembra de granos básicos .Actualmente se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como  tomate y chiltoma.  Además de esto, el tiene otro negocio como es  la venta de ganado, actividad que realiza cuando no esta sembrando sus hortalizas como otra fuente de ingresos.  Byron  muestra su agradecimiento a MiCrédito y Kiva por el apoyo brindado por el préstamo otorgado, pues  trajo muchos cambios positivos  para su economía    familiar, ya que pudo invertir en su negocio, y de esta manera pudo obtener buenos rendimientos en su cosecha que le permitió incrementar sus ganancias. Además con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de ganado, el piensa seguir  comprando  mas ganado para criar y vender. Byron en esta ocasión esta solicita el préstamo para la compra de ganado. Ya que el estima que comprando ganado y luego venderlo a un buen precio, aumentaría sus ganancias. Sus planes futuro es poder comprar una picadora de pastos  y compra de tierras para que sus animales se desarrollen mejor y asi poder incrementar sus ganancias, sus metas próxima es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Byron was born in the region of Rio Abaho, in the municipality of Estelí. He is 35 years old and the father of two children. He works in agriculture, a job he's been doing since he was a young man. He grows basic grains as well as vegetables such as tomatoes and sweet peppers. He also has another business selling livestock when he's not busy with his farm. It is a second source of income for him. 

Byron is very grateful to MiCrédito and Kiva for the support they have provided through the loan. It has brought many positive changes to his family's financial situation as he has been able to invest in his business and obtain a much-improved harvest--both of which have led to an increased income.

He is now considering using the profits to buy more cattle to raise and sell and is seeking a loan for this purpose as he believes that buying cattle and then selling them at a good price will bring in more money.  His future plans include buying a grass shredder and some more land so that his animals develop well. In this way he will be able to earn more money and grow his business.

loans.use: Buy more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Khoang

texts.en: Khoang would like to take out a further loan to buy a larger quantity of bricks and tiles to sell from his store. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of bricks and tiles in bulk.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien would like to take a further loan to buy good quality beef and ingredients to make better food to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good quality beef and ingredients to make better food to sell.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en: Hieu would like to take out a further loan to purchase good food and some equipment for her food stall. Hieu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase good food and some equipment for her food stall.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong would like to take an additional loan to buy equipment and materials to produce more metal products to better satisfy her customers. Hong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy equipment and materials to produce more metal products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida ella vende diferentes tipos de platos como  arroz con pollo,saltado,sopas entre otros la socia trabaja en uno de los mercados de Calca,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como arroz,aceite entre otros para su negocio. 
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Marivel is a member of the Valle Sagrado de Calca Community Bank. As well her regular daily chores, she sells different kinds of meals such as chicken with rice, meat with onions and fries, and soups. Marivel works in one of Calca's markets, work she has been doing for many years. All is going well thanks to the effort she puts in on a daily basis. She is a responsible and hardworking person, always helping her family to make progress.

She is seeking a loan to buy ingredients such as rice and oil for her business. She is very grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice and oil

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en:
Cipriano is a 50-year-old married man and a father of three school-age children from Antequera, Bohol. He has been engaged in a tailoring business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of his income, which he uses for the needs and expenses of the family, especially for the schooling of his children.

Cipriano is asking for a loan to buy more materials for tailoring such as cloth, thread and needles and spare parts for the sewing machine, such as nuts and bolts. With these, he will be able to accept more repairs and cater to more customers, thus augmenting his income.

loans.use: to buy more materials for tailoring such as cloth, thread and needles and spare parts for the sewing machine, such as nuts and bolts

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in adding to the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as soft drinks, to stock her store.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en: Rogelia is a 59-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has run a variety store for more than 20 years. She sells various goods to the people in her community. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, bread, candies, soda, and toiletries. With this loan, Rogelia's dream of improving her business would come true.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food and household products to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of a nine-year-old child. To earn an income, she has run a variety store in her hometown of Antequera, Bohol, for more than ten years. Her husband works as an architect.

Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, soda, snack foods, and toiletries. With these items, she hopes to attract more customers and buyers, thus increasing her sales and profits. In the future, Leonarda hopes to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items to sell in her store

loans.name: Heraclea

texts.en:
Heraclea is a 57-year-old married woman and the mother of four grown-up children. She is from Baclayon, Bohol, and is engaged in a food-vending business. In addition to selling home-cooked food, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store.

Heraclea wants a loan to buy ingredients for food vending, such as flour, sugar, and margarine, and stocks for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, toiletries, and other items. With this loan, Heraclea hopes to augment her income and makes her businesses more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending and variety store businesses

loans.name: Al-Qmr Group

texts.en: The Al-Qmr Group consists of five women who are friends living in the same town -- Aden, Yemen. This group is requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to increase the members' business activity. Mrvt, 33, is the leader of the group. She has been selling clothes and perfumes in her local region. She has requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a supply of fabrics and perfumes in one of the other regions in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabrics for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens and eggs. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located at an urban potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of food to give to the chickens. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to purchase chickens to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a new business, that of a restaurant. Ruth also sells clothes, which adds to her business income. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Hermesa

texts.en:
Hermesa is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Antequera, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for several years now, selling various good and commodities to the people in her area.

Hermesa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, soda, biscuits, chips and other snack foods, and toiletries. Hermesa dreams of expanding her business so that it will continue to generate more income necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, soda, biscuits, chips and other snack foods, and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Arnulfo Jr.

texts.en:
Arnulfo is a 42-year-old man from Maribojoc, Bohol. He has been running a beauty salon in his area for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Arnulfo is asking for a loan to buy more materials for his beauty salon such as scissors, hair blower, hair dye and other items. With this, he will be able to serve more customers in his salon.

In the future, Arnulfo hopes to make his business a success and aims to make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his beauty salon such as scissors, hair blower, hair dye and other items

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 54-year-old married woman from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in selling soft drinks or soda to the people in her area. Elena has been in the business for several years now. Elena wants to take another loan to buy more soft drinks (soda) to sell. With this, she will be able to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks (sodas)

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 60-year-old married woman from San Jose, Talibon. She has been engaged in rice farming together with her husband for more than 10 years now.

Lolita works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Lolita hopes to expand their business but lacks the capital to do so. She wants to take a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, they will be able to improve their harvest and yield.

In the future, Lolita hopes to make her business a success and save money for the future.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Al-Nada Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Nada, and consists of 3 ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240000 YER from AMB. 

Nadia is 49 years old and lives with her family in Aden, Yemen. She sells ladies clothes, incense, perfumes and other goods. She has been in this business for many years and is experienced in sales, which allows her to make a better income. She works hard to offer a good life for her family. She has a regular customer base, because they prefer the quality, affordable prices, and good service that she offers. She is a resourceful and honest woman, dedicated to her work. She applied for a loan of 80000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Janarietta

texts.en: Janarieta is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of five young children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a variety store business selling various goods to the people in her area. She has been in the business for more than nine years now. Janarietta is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, biscuits and toiletries. With this loan, Janarietta will be able attract more customers and buyers in her store thus allowing her to augment her sales and income. In the future, Janarietta hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more food, toiletries and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Fellistus

texts.en:
Fellistus, 39 years old, is married and has 2 children, 5 and 15 years. She describes herself as an honest woman. Fellistus operates a tailoring retail store, providing clothing repair services and making new dresses to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs staff members. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. Fellistus describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices for fabric used to make new dresses. 

Fellistus will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, she took out a loan of KES 20,000, which she repaid successfully. Fellistus' business goal is to run a boutique  within 5 years. She hopes to improve her family's living standards in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 35-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in the fishing business since her husband has worked as a fisherman for several years. This business is the couple's source of income.

Analie is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other items so that her husband will be able to enhance his catch. In the future, Analie hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other items

loans.name: Al-Frdos Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Frdos and consists of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Wafa is 29 years old. She is a hard-working person who has gone through many adversities in her life. For this reason, she has always had a great strength that has allowed her to get ahead. 

Wafa is a sewer. Her business provides her with a source of household income and support. Because her work is recognized as being of good quality, she has acquired good customers recently. For this reason, she is requesting a youth loan of 50,000 YER to purchase sewing items for her business. Her dream is to be able to improve her household financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase sewing items for her business.

loans.name: Ghadir

texts.en:
Ghadir is a 26-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She opened a gift shop in 2010, in order to help her husband provide a better living for their family. She sells gifts, toys, stationery, and household items, and she recently started selling kids' sports clothes and socks to earn more money and increase her income. 

Ghadir is a hard-working woman, and she has an excellent reputation in her area. She is requesting a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy wood needed for heat during the coming winter season. Wood is the main source of heat in her area, and she has to be prepared and sure that her precious family will feel warm during the freezing winter season they expect every year. Ghadir has a newborn baby whom she has to ensure will have a healthy living just like the other family members.

Ghadir is confident that this loan will help her take good care of her family, and she is improving her business slightly with the small profit she is making from her sales. She continues to hope that she will be able to expand her business more and more in the future, move her shop to a more commercial area, and increase the quantity of products she carries.

loans.use: to buy wood needed for warmth during the coming winter season

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en: Mwanalima is a married woman who lives in the town of Msambweni with her life companion and their five children. She is a mother who is in her early 40’s. She operates a fish selling business, selling at the market. She says that it is a profitable project. She has many regular customers who prefer to buy from her because of the quality of products, affordable prices, and, above all, the unequaled service. She is liked by many and her customers increase day by day. Mwanalima sells many types of fish. She is asking for this loan to stock more fish in order to have a variety for her customers to choose. Since she sells fried fish, she will also require some cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Benzo

texts.en:
Benzo lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and has two children. He owns an animal farm where he sells goats, which he has been operating for four years. He is also a farmer, planting crops.
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The main challenge has been the lack of funds.  Benzo is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenya shillings to buy animals. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His dream is to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy animals for sale.

loans.name: Orfelinda

texts.es:
Orfelinda, de 39 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Esteban, su esposo. Juntos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo cría a 2 de ellos en su casa propia. En un espacio de su casa construyó un huerto pequeño, donde siembra variedad de productos de buena calidad los cuales fertilizan con abono orgánico como el guano de ave, por lo que obtiene grandes y saludables alimentos de la tierra. Más adelante está pensando sembrar en terrenos más extensos y así obtener mayores ingresos. Ahora solo se limita a sembrar alverja, maíz, olluco y papa, en terrenos arrendados, ya que no cuenta con unos propios. Según cuenta alquila para todo el año, así ya no tendría que pagar mensualmente. Además cría ovejas que junto a la cosecha de sus alimentos comercializa a la feria de la ciudad. Pero cuando obtiene mayor cantidad, viaja a la capital del país para obtener mayor precio de compra.  Sus planes en la actualidad son ahorrar dinero para comprar sus propios terrenos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Orfelinda, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus próximos sembríos pues se encuentran en temporada de cosecha.
texts.en:
Orfelinda is 39 years old and a hard working woman. She lives in the company of Esteban, her husband. Together, they have five children, but she only raises two of them in her own home. In a space of her home she constructed a small garden where she plants a variety of good-quality products which she fertilizes with organic fertilizer, like bird guano, because of which she obtains large and healthy food from the earth. In the future she is thinking of planting in more extensive plots of land and therefore obtaining more income. Now, she only limits herself to planting peas, corn, ullucos, and potatoes, on rented land since she has none of her own. According to what she says, she rents it for the whole year, and therefore would not have to pay monthly. Furthermore, she raises sheep that along with her food crops she sells in the city market. However, when she obtains a larger quantity, she travels to the capital of the country to obtain a higher selling price.

Her current plans are to save money to buy her own land. This is her eighth loan from MFP, and she is waiting for a small loan to achieve her objectives. On the other hand, she promises again to complete her payments. Furthermore, it pleases her to be a part of her association because all of its members are responsible and supportive people.

Orfelinda will invest the money requested in the purchase of organic fertilizer to spread among her next sown seeds since they now find themselves in the harvest season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy, de 27 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de sus padres y su hermano Joseph, a quien cuida en la casa donde nació. Tiene 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a mejorar sus sembríos y a mantenerlos en buen estado. Es por eso que cuando adquirió mayor edad, tomó la administración de algunos de los sembríos de sus padres. En la actualidad, siembra maíz, papa, alverja. En un comienzo trabajó en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, con el tiempo logró obtener compradores mayoristas quienes negociaban sus cosechas, tanto que no se abastecía, por lo que alquila terrenos agrícolas en otros lugares. Ahora se encuentra en la siembra de maíz en varias hectáreas de terreno productivo que espera puede brindarle los resultados deseados y así seguir creciendo en la siembra. “El secreto es dedicarle todo el tiempo posible al cuidado de los surcos”, afirma.  Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo económico recibido pues le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos; además aumentó el capital de trabajo que tenía para mantener sus sembríos. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Fredy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico que le ayuden a mejorar sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
27-year old Fredy is a hardworking man. He lives with his parents and his brother Joseph whom he has looked after ever since he was born. Fredy has ten years of experience in agriculture; his parents taught him how to farm the land and look after it well while he was still a young man. When he became an adult he was entrusted by his parents with some of their land. Now he grows corn, potatoes, and peas.

At first he worked in his own fields, but as time passed he negotiated with wholesale buyers to take his crops. Now he also rents productive land in other areas where he grows several hectares of corn. He hopes for good harvests so that he can continue expanding his farm.

"The secret is to spend as much time as possible looking after the crops," he says. This is his third loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the financial support which has helped him earn more money. As well Fredy has increased his working capital and can buy the necessary supplies for his fields. For this reason he promises to be punctual with the repayments. He plans to use the loan to buy bags of manure to spread on the crops and improve the harvest.

loans.use: To buy bags of manure

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 42-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has operated a sari-sari (variety store) business for several years. Jocelyn works hard to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the family's needs. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as canned goods, chips and snack foods, toiletries, etc. to sell. By increasing her inventory, she will be able to attract more customers to her store. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Hosnia Group

texts.en:
This loan group is called Hosnia and has five members, all of them women. They are hardworking and live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Ebtsam, 21 years old, leads this group. She is married and has one child. Ebtsam is a housewife who works hard to ensure that her children will have a good life. She is requesting a youth loan for 40,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances.

loans.use: to buy home appliances

loans.name: Ynabia Al-Khyr Group

texts.en: This group, which is called Ynabia Al-Khyr, consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Altaf is 31 years old and has 3 children. She has requested a loan of 40,000 YER to buy a new fridge. In the future, she would like to make more improvements to her home and to her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge for personal use.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Making some improvements in her life is one of many goals that Riziki has. She is a hardworking woman, despite being alone with no support. She is a widow who earns a living selling dumplings and porridge from her home. She has been in this business since 2010; thanks to it, she has been able to provide for her three children. Riziki says that she faces very many challenges since her husband passed. She has a burden to bear but she trusts God that she will one day have a luxurious life. She wants to make some investments in her business, but she does not have enough working capital to do so. For this reason, Riziki is asking for a loan to buy the wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil, and corn flour she requires to make her products.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil, and corn flour

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en: Sikukuu, 35, is a single mother due to widowhood. She takes care of two school-age children in the rural area of Msambweni. She is a dedicated woman who does not fear any challenges. For the past two years, she has been selling fried fish in one of the busy trading centers. She says that she faces the challenge of high competition in the area where she sells. But, thanks to her good services and quality fish -- and above all, her kindness -- she has been able to establish a good client base. Sikukuu wants to make some investments in her business, so she is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of fish and cooking oil. Her aim is to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en: Mwatime, 36, is the industrious mother of four children. She lives with her family in the suburban area of Msambweni. Fifteen years ago, Mwatime began running a food stall that is located in a strategic place at the market. She sells a variety of dishes and beverages for breakfast, lunch, and supper. In addition to this business, she sells fish during the evening hours while her daughter takes care of the food stall. Her desire is to always have all the necessary ingredients in stock so as to meet her customers' demand. Currently, her stock of ingredients needs to be increased. She is taking this loan to buy wheat and corn flour, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, and other food items. Her dream is to transform her business into a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and soft drinks for her food stall

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is well known in her neighborhood for her jovial character. She is liked by many, since she not only has kindness but also due to her positive advices. She lives in the town of Msambweni, which is well known for the activities of fish selling, coconut selling, and food vending. In the outskirts of this town, Mwanasha lives with her family (her spouse and six children) in a house that they own. She earns a living selling fish at the market – a business that is over ten years old. 

In the past few weeks, demand for fish has risen and she wants to take advantage by buying more stock of fish. This is why she is taking out this loan to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives the Mombasa area of Coast province. She is married and has six children, two of whom are in school. She owns a tailoring shop, which she has been operating for 15 years. Rosemary employs one servant and also runs some rental houses.

She learnt about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges facing her business are the high cost of materials and bad debts.

Rosemary is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase materials for making clothes, etc. She intends to use part of the extra income she earns to promote her business, improve her family’s standard of living and pay for the children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She has been working in food production and sales for 15 years. In 2002, Fatima started her own business to help her husband increase their income and improve their living.

Fatima specializes in Mouneh production, that is, preparing foods to be stored for seasons when they are not available. The quality of her products assures loyalty from her customers and increases in requests.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy tools to make her business easier. She will also use part of the loan to help her husband cover their family's requests, through paying her children’s tuition fees.

This is her first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. She hopes that future loans will be invested in expanding production in her business and opening a wide factory with a big retail shop.

loans.use: To buy tools to make her business easier

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is the father of six grown children, with only the last one still in school. For the past year, Sammy has owned a secondhand clothing shop. He wants to employ more people. Sammy is also formally employed.

Sammy learned about Milango through a friend who invited him; he joined a group with the aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. Sammy's main challenges are bad debts and price fluctuations. Sammy is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to expand his business by buying some clothing to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to help provide food, security and healthcare for his family.

loans.use: To buy some clothing to sell

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Being a widow is not a limiting factor to making progress in life. Binti is passing through various adversities but she does not give up. She is the mother of five children who live with her in the town of Msambweni.

For several years, Binti has been farming, growing a variety of crops such as corn, legumes, and vegetables. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to educate her children. Binti is asking for a loan to buy planting materials and to pay for cultivation costs. She hopes to have good harvest this season as the winter rains have already begun.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and to pay for cultivation costs.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en: Biasha is divorced and she lives with her two children in the town of Msambweni. Despite the various adversities she is going through, Biasha does not die hard. She was able to open a small business selling coconuts. Biasha knows that hard work pays; this slogan always rings in her mind. Her dream is to expand her business and have a prosperous future. Biasha knows that this is possible through determination and God’s will. She is asking for a loan to buy more coconuts to supply to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of the Kongowea area of Coast province in Kenya. She is a single mother of one child. Beatrice owns a wine and spirits shop, a business that she has been running for two years. She intends to increase her sources of income by opening a mobile money transfer shop.

Beatrice learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are a lack of funds to grow the business and competition.

Beatrice is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to open a mobile money transfer shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family’s standard of living, especially through the education of her child. She aspires to own more centres in the future.

loans.use: To open a mobile money transfer shop.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a man with many goals to achieve and he struggles everyday to see his dreams come true. He is the father of three bouncing children. His wife is a businesswoman. Together they contribute to the welfare of the house. Edward has operated a car wash business for the last five years. He has been able to establish a good client base. Edward is asking for this loan to buy a water pump. He is sure to increase his income from this investment.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for his car wash.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en: The desire for a prosperous future is the dream of every merchant and Mesalim is an example of this. She is a married woman who has 4 children and lives with her family in the coastal region of Kenya. Mesalim is a very industrious woman who has been operating a tailoring business for the past 8 years. Her dream is to expand her business and have a worthy life. Mesalim is asking for this loan to buy another sewing machine, fabrics and thread. She hopes to have a dressmaking training college in the future.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine, fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Like any other focused merchant, Fatuma aims at seeing her business flourish. She is the married mother of two children, who are 20 and 15 years old. She is 49 years old, and she is happy, since she feels responsible as she helps her spouse with the daily expenses. She has been operating a fish selling business for the last 15 years and she has gained a lot of sales experience. She is well known in the neighborhood. 

Fatuma has very many goals to reach and she struggles hard to reach them. Despite have challenges, she is determined to overcome them and achieve a prosperous future. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a resident of the Kongowea area of Coast province in Kenya. She is married and has one child.  She owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for four years.

Leah learnt about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are bad debts and fluctuating prices.

Leah is applying for a loan of 75,150 Kenya shillings to purchase foodstuff like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, bread and milk, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of the family. 

She aspires to owning other centers and to paying for her children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase food stuff like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 29-year-old single man who has been working as a barber for 11 years. He was only 8 years old when he started working because of his parents' difficult financial situation. Abbass was forced to leave his childhood play, dreams, school and friends to turn towards work and to fight for his own and his family's livelihood.

Abbass is a hard worker who has put in so much effort and has opened his own shop. Today he is well known in the region, with his long experience and remarkable touch.

Abbass is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to start a new business to increase his income and to keep improving his living standards. Abbass will start selling calves and will work hard to increase his income as much as he can. He will develop his businesses to make sure that when he decides to start his own family, he will be capable of handling all of their requests and replying to all of their needs. Abbass will make sure that his children won't suffer any of what he did. He'll make sure that they get the best education ever, unlike him, who didn't have the chance to finish his elementary education. Abbass hopes to improve both businesses and to develop them as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy calves to start a new animal sales business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 28-year-old man who is married to Fatuma. They are blessed with two children, who are the source of their happiness in marriage. 

For five years, Christopher has been running a cyber café, providing a variety of services like browsing, printing, etc. His business has been doing well, and his customers have increased.

Christopher has noticed that he needs more computers for efficient service delivery. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy two computers for his cyber café.

loans.use: to buy two computers for his cyber café.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 39-year-old divorced man and the father of three children. He has been working as a tailor since 21 years ago. In 1992, he started his own business. Youssef is a professional tailor; his long experience gave him customers’ trust and support.

Youssef is Syrian, but it's been a long time since he came and lived in Lebanon. He started his own business, made his own family and settled.

He is well known for his professionalism in work in addition to his good reputation and excellent customer service.

Youssef works hard to satisfy his family and to provide them with everything they might need. To improve his living, he must keep on supporting his business with the necessary needs. That's why he applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools, needles, buttons, thread and textiles.

He is looking forward to expanding his business and introducing his customers to new products through opening his own atelier in the future.

Youssef puts so much effort into improving his business as much as he can to please his beloved children. He takes good care of them, especially that he takes the role of the mother and the father at the same time. He hopes to keep on providing them with all their needs, especially the love and caring they need.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools, needles, buttons, thread and textiles.

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es:
Bethy, de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su hija Stefany en la casa que heredó de sus padres y donde vive desde que nació. Es agricultora desde hace 7 años, produce papa y granos; paralelamente a la siembra cría animales de ganado vacuno los toros que vende una vez que son grandes y de buen peso para comprar pequeños, de esa manera  genera los ingresos para su familia. Todas las cosechas que tiene los vende en el mercado principal de su ciudad en los días miércoles y domingo cuando es la feria comercial y cada 2  meses aproximadamente vende sus animales en la feria ganadera de su zona.  Durante estos años le ha resultado beneficioso en sus ganancias por lo que se anima a continuar con este esfuerzo en bienestar de la educación de sus hijos menores. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva.
Bethy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en: Bethy is 37 and is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her daughter, Stefany, in the house that she inherited from her parents and where she has lived since she was born.  She has worked in agriculture for 7 years.  She produces potatoes and grains.  Parallel to growing crops, she also raises cattle.  She sells the bulls once they are big and at a good weight to be able to buy smaller ones.  In this way, she generates income for her family.  She sells her harvests in the main market in her city on Wednesdays and Sundays, when the commercial markets are held.  Approximately every two months, she sells her animals at the livestock market in her area.  During these years, everything has gone well with her profits, which motivates her to continue with this effort for the well-being of her young children.  She has worked for years with her communal bank, "Productores Huancas," and this is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  Her perserverance is admirable since she is one of the members who has been with her group the longest.  She continues to renew her effort and positive attitude.  Bethy will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to spread among her plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old single man who has been working in construction for eight years. In 2007, he started working on his own. He has very good experience and he is skillful and talented in his domain. 

Ahmad is well-known in the region and he is working hard to expand his reputation all over the region and abroad to attract contractors’ attention and offers.

He specializes in cement work and is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy iron and wood pillars to develop his business.

He hopes to open a contracting company in the future and to recruit someone in the near future to expand his working region more and more.

loans.use: To buy iron and wood pillars to develop his business

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a divorced mother of three children. She has a small tailoring workshop in her home, where she makes and repairs clothing for men, women and children. She has sales experience of six years which has enabled her to gain more confidence among her customers. Mwanahamisi got her skills from her mother, and she has been able to effectively exercise them. She makes enough income to cover the household expenses. She knows that she has to fight to reach success and day by day she does so. 

Currently, she has many orders from her customers which have to be met, but she needs to buy fabrics, thread and lace among other materials, which is why she is asking for this loan. She looks forward to your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread and lace among other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional sheep, food and a covering for her small herd.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid, age 30, earns a living by operating a taxi business. He is a hard-working and honest person and has been driving for many years. He and his wife have two children. The family lives in Taiz, Yemen. 
 
Khalid has requested a youth loan in the amount of 150000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan funds to purchase spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia, age 50, is a rice farmer. She has been engaged in this business for several years. For additional income, she sells dried fish in the market. She and her husband have five children and the family lives in Talibon, Bohol.
 
Rosalia is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer for the rice field and to buy more dried fish to offer for sale. With the loan funds, she will be able to improve the harvest from the farm and enhance sales in the dried fish business.
 
In the future, Rosalia dreams of making her business a success, saving money for reinvestment into the same business, and adding to her savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and to buy dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a fruit vendor. She is a hard-working, good, and wise entrepreneur who has shown great skills in proper business management from the previous loan investment. She is very sure that she will bring these same qualities to this new investment should this opportunity be granted to her. She is a dedicated person, motovated by the urge to move ahead. 

Mwanaisha says that the last loan was of great help to her. With this new loan, she will buy coconuts to offer for sale. 

Her goal is to grow her business and to provide her family a prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Elba Francisca

texts.es:
Elba originaria de León, pero  vive en Estelí, soltera, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 23,30 y 32, de oficio comerciante, trabaja vendiendo comida. Ella dice que su mama comenzó el negocio, pero ella la apoyaba en todo, luego ella decidió  quedarse con el negocio, de laque es propietaria hace  10 años,  ha sido mi primer negocio con el que ayudo a salir adelante a  sus  hijos, comercializa sus productos en la misma comunidad donde vive,  le gustaría ampliar sus productos por todo el mercado de Estelí. Sus expectativas es seguir   trabajando arduamente en su comedor para incrementar más ingresos.
Elba solicita el préstamo para comprar leña, carne. Verduras, aceite, arroz, frijoles, etc. Toda la materia prima que necesita para hacer su comida. Ella estima que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar más productos   para su negocio y asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, espera incrementar sus ganancias, sus planes futuro es invertir en su negocio los productos que no tenga en existencia, para  ofrecer mas variedad de comida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elba is from León, but she lives in Estelí. She is a single mother with three children of the ages 23, 30 and 32. She works as a merchant selling food. She says her mom started the business but she always supported her.  Later, she decided to take over the business and has been the owner for the past ten years. 

This is her first business and it has helped her children be successful. She sells her food in the same community as she lives in. She would like to expand her food at the Estelí Market. She expects to keep working hard in her food stall in order to increase her income. 

Elba is requesting the loan in order to buy firewood, meat, vegetables, oil, rice, beans etc. All the necessary ingredients to make food. She believes this loan will help her to buy more supplies for her business and in this way keep her customers satisfied. She expects to increase her profits and her future plans are to invest in ingredients her business does not currently have so that she can offer a greater variety of food to her clients.

loans.use: to buy firewood, meat, vegetables, oil, rice, beans etc.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 51-year-old married man and father of six children. He is from San Jose, Talibon. 

Rogelio has run and operated an auto repair and vulcanizing shop for more than 25 years. This is the source of his income. He is asking for a loan to buy more materials for his repair shop, such as screwdrivers, nuts and bolts and lubricating oil. With these materials, he will be able to cater to more customers in his shop, thus augment his business. 

In the future, Rogelio hopes to make his business a success and to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his repair shop, such as screwdrivers, nuts and bolts and lubricating oil.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have been running a motorcycle business for more than five years now. This business is the source of their income. Angeline is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle and to pay for its maintenance. To generate more income necessary for her family's needs, especially for her children's education, she dreams of improving the business and exploring another venture.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle and to pay for its maintenance.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, age 48, is a rice farmer. She and her husband have been engaged in this business for more than 18 years. They have nine children and live in San Jose, Talibon. 

Virginia is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the rice farm. With the loan funds, they will be able to produce a good harvest from the field.
 
In the future, Virginia hopes of expanding their business and continue to support the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the rice field

loans.name: Mwanamimi

texts.en:
Mwanamimi is making a new investment in her coconut selling business, which has been flourishing over the past few months. She is happy to have seen her businesses improve through careful implementation of her previous loan. She is sure that this investment will also have a positive impact. 

She wants to gather a stock of coconuts so as to have ready stock to sell. She is a responsible person, as demonstrated through her previous loan, which she was able to repay faithfully.  

Mwanamimi is eager to implement and repay this loan, and she looks forward to availing herself of subsequent loans so that she can move forward with her business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of coconuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.en:
In 2009, these tribal women came together to help one another enhance their economic activities by forming a group called “Esther Group”. They live in Motbung village of Manipur state, which is located in the northeastern part of India.

Hebem is pictured with a raised hand. She is the mother of three daughters and two sons, and she is 40 years old. She lives as a single parent after her husband abandoned her for another woman. Now she lives with her children and one sister in-law. In spite of her marriage problem, she is determined and happy that all her children go to a private school in the nearby town, which is 5 km away.

She owns a paddy field to cultivate rice, which is a staple food for her people. She practices jhum cultivation [slash-and-burn] and grows vegetables such as pulses, pumpkins, yams and peas to sell at the market. She also cultivates ginger on a large scale for bigger profits. Every night before going to bed, she weaves clothes to sell to meet her daily needs. She is thankful to her sister-in-law for standing beside her and helping to raise the children.

With her previous loan, she has been investing in the ginger plantation, usually harvested in the month of January. Now she is hoping to get a good harvest when the month comes. The proceeds help towards enrolling her children in school for another term. She says, “I may miss all the comforts of a caring husband but I am happy all my children are still going to school”.

She needs another loan in order to plan for 2013 income activities. As mentioned above, her ginger proceeds will meet the children's admission requirements only. She plans to use this loan to buy fresh yarn for her weaving and better quality of ginger saplings for the next cultivation. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members requested another loan to improve upon their respective income generating activities, which also include weaving and agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fresh yarn for her weaving and better quality of ginger saplings for the next cultivation.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 44-year-old single woman from Israel’s Negev region. She is a veteran customer of KIEDF and has been incredibly successful with her business.
