Miriam is a seamstress who also teaches sewing courses. She works at area community centers and is passing on her significant skill and professionalism to others.

Miriam needs this loan to assist with purchasing two additional sewing machines, an electric cutting machine, four workstation tables and chairs, shelving, sewing supplies and cloth.

Miriam works throughout the Negev and wants to continue and expand her business. One day she hopes to employ her students in her own shop but right now she wants to purchase a car for travel in the region to teach her lessons.

loans.use: to purchase two additional sewing machines, an electric cutting machine, four workstation tables and chairs, shelving, sewing supplies and cloth.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Margaret Gina, age 47, is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. They have been engaged in this business for six years. They have five children and live in Talibon, Bohol. 

Margaret Gina is asking for a loan in order to buy fishing nets, plywood, and paint, which will be used to repair the boat. 

In the future, Margaret Gina hopes to improve the family business and allow her family to experience the fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, plywood, and paint, which will be used to repair her boat

loans.name: Macilinda

texts.en: Macilinda is a 62-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been a fish vendor for more than 11 years now, selling fresh and dried fish to the people in her community. This is the source of her income which she uses for the needs and expenses of her family. Macilinda wants to use this loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita earns a living by raising hogs. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. She and her husband have nine grown children and live in Talibon, Bohol. 
 
Rosita wants to expand her business but lacks the capital do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from CEVI in order to buy pig feed and additional piglets to raise.
 
In the future, Rosita wants to improve her livelihood and to save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Abu Nasar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Abu Nasar and consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Among the borrowers is Hadia, age 27, who is a hard-working homemaker. She and her husband have five children. She assists her husband in supporting their children. Although her income is not very consistent, she does what she can to provide for the family. She has requested a youth loan in the amount of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a washing machine for her home.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her home

loans.name: Alan Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Alan Eduardo es casado,  tiene 23 años de edad, cursó los grado de educación diversificada, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte a estudiantes del lugar donde vive hacia otros lugares de nuestro país, inició este negocio con el apoyo de su padre y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para repara su vehículo y cambio de algunos repuesto ya desgastados, para ofrecer un excelente servicio a sus cliente, y como también dar un servicio completo a su vehículo, quiere seguir mejorando y tener una buena productividad.
texts.en:
Alan Eduardo is married and 23 years old. He has a high school education and one child. He makes a living by offering students transportation services between their place of residence and other parts of the country. He started this business with the help of his father and now has five years of experience.

He is requesting a loan, which he will use to repair his vehicle and change some parts that are now worn out in order to offer his customers excellent service. He will also have a full service done on his vehicle. He wants to continue improving his business and have good productivity.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo sells traditional clothing items called khangas to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for six years and has gained valuable experience that keeps the business flourishing. Her customers like her because of her jovial nature and the quality service she offers. She sells door to door and through orders. She and her life companion are blessed with four children and the family lives in the town of Msambweni. 

Currently, she has many orders to fulfill. Mwanakombo does not want to disappoint her regular customers, and this is why she wants to make an investment in her business by purchasing bales of khangas to offer for sale. However, she does not have enough capital to invest in a good variety of khangas. For this reason, she is asking for support in the form of a loan.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas to offer for sale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, age 44, raises hogs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for more than six years. She and her husband have two grown children and live in San Jose, Talibon.
 
She is requesting a loan in order to buy pig feed and piglets to raise.
 
In the future, Zenaida hopes to expand her business and to afford her family the possibility to experience fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 52 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive con su esposo Gay, con quien tiene 4 hijos. Pero solo vive con uno de ellos Cirila, a quien cuida en la casa que compró hace 10 años. Desde hace 20 años trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería, sus cultivos principales son trigo, papa, cebada, arveja y maíz; también cría animales de ganado vacuno, principalmente toros para venderlos en las ferias ganaderas. Una vez que es la época de la cosecha vienen a buscarla comerciantes mayoristas que compran por camiones su cosecha, de esa manera obtiene las ganancias y para ella esta manera de trabajo es mas practico porque ya no gasta en  el pago de transporte, aunque admita que con esta modalidad  las ganancias son menores, durante estos años de trabajo ella y su esposo han visto que  es una buena opción de trabajo  las dificultades fueron superadas a lo largo de los años  porque solvento el gasto de sus 4 hijos y ahora ella seguirá trabajando con esta misma forma de trabajo que le  permitirá seguir  sosteniéndose. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 12 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva. Carmen, invertirá el dinero en la compra de semillas de alfalfa y así podrá alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 52 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Gay, with whom she has 4 children. But only one child, Cirila, lives with them. She looks after Cirila in the house that she bought 10 years ago. For the last 20 years she has worked in agriculture and cattle farming. Mainly she grows wheat, potatoes, barley, peas and corn. She also rears cattle, mostly bulls, to sell at the livestock fairs. At harvest time wholesale buyers come in trucks to where she lives to buy what she has harvested. This is how she earns her income. It is more practical for her this way because she does not have to spend money on transport, although she admits that the money she earns is lower. 

Over the years Carmen and her husband have come to realise that the work they do is a good option for them. Any difficulties they have encountered during this time have been overcome because they have been able to provide for their 4 children. She will continue to do the same work now, as it will enable her to sustain their family life. She has been working collectively in the communal bank "Productores Huancas" for several years. This is the 12th loan that she has requested from MFP. Her stamina is admirable; she is one of the longest serving members of the group. With this loan she will renew her efforts and her positive attitude. Carmen will invest the money in the purchase of alfalfa seeds so that she can feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years. This business is the source of their income.

Myrna is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and rope. This loan would allow her husband to increase his daily catch, thus giving them more fish to sell at the market. Myrna is optimistic that they will be able to improve their business and make it sustainable through hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and rope.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Every person has the desire to obtain a life worth living and be a responsible member of society. Binti is no exception to this. A married lady who takes care of her three children, she has a small business selling coconuts door-to-door. She has already established a good clientele base and achieves good results from her enterprise.

Binti, who has requested this loan to buy more coconuts, works hard everyday since she knows this is the only way to achieve the success she desires. Fully dedicated to her business, she hopes to have a handcart for transporting and supplying her product in the future.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade her salon by purchasing a computer, treatment chair, permanent makeup, cosmetic supplies, and a divider for treatment areas.

loans.name: Al-Fteh Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-fteh, which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Fatima is the leader of this group. She is 36 years old, married, and has eight children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife who works hard to give her children a good life. She intends to buy home appliances. Her portion of the loan from AMB is 40,000 YER to buy a refrigerator for her home.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is 39 years old, a married man with four children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  He owns his house, and he has applied for a loan of YER 150,000 from AMB to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.name: Al-Tadhamn Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tadhamn and consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB.

Sabah, a member of Al-Tadhamn, is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. She owns a house and has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Om-Ziad Group

texts.en:
This group, which is called Om-Ziad, consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Najood, a 28-year-old married woman, is a tailor who loves her business. She started it by saving a small amount of money, and her success has motivated her to expand.

Najood is now requesting a youth loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator for her home.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her home.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in the urban area of Msambweni. She is the mother of seven. 

For almost ten years now, she has been operating a kiosk, which is home-based.  Binti sells a variety of home products and foodstuffs.

Like any other good merchant, Binti would wish to see her business grow. Her stock has gone down, and she wants to increase her inventory. However, she is faced with an inadequacy in working capital. This is why she visited Yehu offices to ask for a loan to buy basic grains, foodstuffs, and detergents, among other instant goods.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, foodstuffs, and detergents, among other instant goods.

loans.name: Mbua

texts.en:
The desire to have a better future is a common thing among a majority of people. However, this success does not come without hard work and determination. 

Mbua is an industrious woman who lives in the rural area of Msambweni. She takes care of her four children. 
 
She is a widow who earns a living selling kerosene from her home.  She has been in this activity for the last nine years, and she has gained a lot of sales experience. To increase profits, she has to increase sales, and that is why she wants to make some investment in her business. She will buy gallons of kerosene for sale. 

Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: buy stocks of kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti lives in a house she owns in the town of Msambweni. She is married to Bakari, a businessman. They are blessed with two young children. To help her husband with the household expenses Mwanasiti decided to start a coconut selling business. She sells wholesale to the neighboring county. It has been a profitable business and has given her good results and sales experience for two years. Currently, she has received orders from her regular customers and she does not want to disappoint them. She wants to buy a stock of coconuts for selling.

loans.use: to buy a stock of coconuts.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a food vendor. She is a previous borrower and has seen her business benefit from her previous loan. She is asking for a loan in order to make new investments. She is happy for the support she received and the support she is hoping to receive. Fatuma has positive testimony regarding the progress of her business and the increased well-being of her family. She says that the previous loan had a positive impact on both her food-selling business and her family’s living standards.
 
She wishes to have a ready stock of ingredients for preparing foods. Her new loan funds will allow her to buy wheat flour, corn flour, basic grains, cooking fat, and other necessities. She hopes to grow her business and hire employees in future.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, corn flour, basic grains, cooking fat, and other necessities

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is taking out a new loan to expand on her existing business. 

She says that her biggest challenge is competition, especially where her locale is. However, her only secret to outshining her competitors is through selling quality products, high customer care services, above all being in good relations with everyone. This character has enabled her to reach success. Thanks for the previous loan that had a positive impact in her business.

In the past few weeks, Mwanakombo has noticed that demand for fish has risen, and she wants to take advantage of this. She is requesting another loan to buy more stocks of fish and cooking oil. She is sure that she will have what her customers want.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, 39, is a married mother of two children. She lives in the urban area of Msambweni in her own house. Her life partner is Bakari, a businessman. In 2007, Mwanajuma started a fish selling business selling on one of the busy streets of the town that leads to the town market. She says that it has been a profitable project and gives thanks for it; she has been able to provide for her family with basic needs. 

Mwanajuma wants to add to her stock of fish and cooking oil but she does not have enough cash to do so. This is why she visited the Yehu offices to request a loan to make this investment. She is a dedicated person who believes in hard work since she knows that the only way to reach success is through hard work.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fish and cooking oil for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase much needed stock, improve her shelving, and upgrade her refrigerators.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 21 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as bags of sugar, flour, salt, boxes of chicken, snacks and sweets. She has been doing this for many years. Lilian needs a loan to restock the shop. She hopes to use her profits to expand the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to restock her shop.

loans.name: Manu

texts.en:
Manu is 37 years old and married, with six children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as chicken, bags of sugar, salt, and snacks. She has been doing this for two years. Manu needs a loan to restock the shop. She hopes to use her profits to expand the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sugar, salt, sweets, clothes, and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 40 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Anibal, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Lisbeth y Adriano. A los que cuida en la casa que heredó hace 20 años. Con 17 años de experiencia sembrando trigo, cebada habas y papa, a logrado fortalecer la economía de su hogar, todos los días se encarga de  hacer un recorrido por sus tierras de cultivo, una vez llegada la temporada de cosecha tiene la tarea de envasarlos en costales para llevarlos todos los fines de semana a la feria comercial del mercado que esta en la zona urbana para venderlos y de esa manera tener las ganancias que se hicieron esperar alrededor de 6 meses, en las épocas de cosecha necesita de mucha ayuda es por eso que todos los integrantes de su familia trabajan y también contrata a peones para que ayuden en esta labor es así que esta muy contenta de realizar este trabajo porque le permite estar disfrutando del paisaje y aunque el trabajo sea muy  fatigoso es su forma de vida. Para los próximos años su deseo es sembrar mayor cantidad de extensiones de tierra para poder seguir vendiendo y viendo las ganancias. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva. Gladys, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuirlos entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Gladys, who is 40 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Anibal. The have 2 children: Lisbeth and Adriano. She takes care of them in the house she inherited 20 years ago. 

With 17 years of experience planting wheat, barley, beans and potatoes, she has been able to strengthen her home's finances. Every day she does the rounds of her farmland. Once the harvest season arrives her task is to pack the crops into sacks to take them to the market every weekend, in the urban area. She sells them there and so makes the profits she has been waiting 6 months for. At harvest times she needs a lot of help and all the members of her family work. She also hires labourers to help with this work. She is very happy to carry out this work because it allows her to enjoy the countryside, and, although the work is very tiring, it is her way of life. 

Over the next few years, her wish is to plant more stretches of land in order to keep selling and making profits. She has worked for a few years in a group in the Communal Bank "productores huancas" and this is the 6th loan with MFP. Her perseverance is admirable, as she is one of the oldest members of her group. She continues to renew her effort and her positive attitude. 

Gladys will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to distribute over her planted fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
Edwin  originario de Estelí, 31 años de edad, casado, padre de 1hijo, de oficio carpintero. El cuenta que comenzó trabajando para otras personas y fue allí donde aprendió el oficio de carpintería, a la edad de 18 años, pero después de haber ahorrado su dinero,  pudo comprar sus propias herramientas y fue allí que decidió poner su propio taller de carpintería, para independizarse. El no cuenta con otros ingresos solo los que le genera su negocio, de esta manera le gustaría dar a conocer  sus muebles como mesas, gabinetes, roperos, y sillas en las casas comerciales de otros departamentos, sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio y promover sus conocimientos en muebles, para ofrecer a sus clientes un producto de calidad.
Edwin solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera y otros materiales  que necesita utilizar para la elaboración de sus muebles como pintura, barniz, sener, lijas y pegamentos. Ya que el estima que le ayudaría a ampliar su negocio,  se acerca la temporada navideña, en donde la demanda de sus productos de muebles crece,  su deseo es preparase con los pedidos que le hacen los clientes y poder vender rápido su producto y alcanzar otros mercados, ya que sus planes  futuros es mejorar su taller y poder tener mas productos en su inventario, y asi  poder exhibir sus muebles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edwin, 31, is originally from Estelí. He is married with one son, and he is a carpenter. He started working for other people and that was where he learned the carpentry trade at the age of 18. However, after saving up his money, he was able to buy his own tools and he decided to start his own carpentry workshop, in order to become independent. He has no other income apart from what his business generates. He would like to introduce his furniture, like tables, cabinets, wardrobes, and chairs into the commercial establishments in other departments. He hopes to keep growing his business and develop his knowledge of furniture in order to offer his customer's quality products. 

Edwin is applying for the loan to buy wood and other materials that he needs to build furniture, like paint, varnish, thinner, sandpaper, and glue. He believes this will help him increase his business, because the holiday season is coming, and the demand for furniture products goes up. His wish is to prepare himself with the orders that customers place and to be able to sell his product quickly and reach other markets. His future plans are to improve his workshop and have more products in his inventory. That way he will be able to display his furniture for his customers.

loans.use: to buy wood and other materials he needs to build furniture, such as paint, varnish, thinner, sandpaper and glue.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Héctor, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos, Paolo al que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 30 años. 
Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas del campo, cada día trabaja en el campo verificando sus terrenos de cultivo  para fertilizarlos, siembra todo tipo de cultivo que la beneficia  cuando llega  a cosechar y su deseo es seguir implementando sus herramientas para  optimizar sus cosechas, también cría animales  que vende e manera periódica  en la feria ganadera de su zona y algunos clientes acuden a su casa  comprarle. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 13 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva.
Aydee, invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico que distribuirá entre sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Aydee is 46 years old. She is a hardworking woman.  She lives in the company of her husband Hector, with whom she has 4 sons.  But she only lives with one of them, Paolo, who she cares for in the house she inherited 30 years ago.  

Throughout her life, she has been tied to the tasks of a country life.  She works the land everyday, ensuring that crops are fertilized. During harvest season, she benefits from planting many different types of crops.  Her wish is to continue using her tools to optimize her crops.  She also breeds animals, which she sells periodically at her local cattle fair; some clients go to her house to make their purchase.  

She has been part of the communal bank "productores huancas" for several years, and this will make her 13th loan with MFP. Her perseverance is to be admired because she is one of the members in the group with the longest history.  

For this occasion she continues to renew her efforts and positive attitude.  Aydee, will invest the money to buy various sacs of organic fertilizer, which she will use next time she sows.

loans.use: to buy sacs of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Los Angeles Leales Group

texts.es: Buenas tardes. Este es el Grupo “Los Ángeles Leales” conformado por 07 socios emprendedores. Rosario tiene 29 años casada con 2 hijos aún dependientes, la cual ha sido su motor para seguir adelante. Hace más de 2 años cuenta con una bodega la cual ofrece gaseosas, golosinas, helados entre otros productos. Gracias al préstamo que le brindo Edaprospo y Kiva sigue mejorando su negocio. El mayor anhelo de Rosario es seguir creciendo su bodega. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito, la cual comprará bebidas, golosinas y abarrotes y de esta manera tener surtido su negocio. Se siente feliz y agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Rosario se encuentra sentada en la parte de adelante, es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste chompa a rayas y polo negro. La señora Teodosia de chompa blanca es una socia pasiva que en el siguiente ciclo se estará reintegrando al grupo.
texts.en:
Good afternoon. This is the group “Los Ángeles Leales,” made up of seven entrepreneurial members. Rosario is 29 years old, married, with two children still dependent, who have been her driving force to continue forward. It has been more than two years that she has owned a grocery store, which offers soda, candy, and ice cream, among other products. 

Thanks to the loan that Edaprospo and Kiva provided her, she continues to improve her business. Rosario’s greatest wish is to continue growing her grocery store. With the goal of continuing to improve she applied for the credit, which will buy her beverages, candy, and groceries, and so have her business stocked. She feels happy and thankful to the people who made this loan possible. 

Rosario can be found seated in the front part of the picture, the first on the left side, dressed in a striped sweater and a black t-shirt. Teodosia, in the white sweater, is a passive member who in the following cycle will be reintegrating into the group.

loans.use: to buy beverages, candy, and groceries.

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele is a 48-year-old married woman, with five children.  

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Pele has requested a loan to buy chemicals, shovels, crops, and a wheelbarrow.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Pele hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheebarrow, fertilizer, shovels, and crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cutter.

loans.name: Maria Falanika

texts.en: Maria is a 37-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and yam to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Maria has requested a loan to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits  Maria hopes to give her children better education.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow, a bush knife, shovels and fertilizers to expand her farming business.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a 20 year old single woman with no children. 

She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. Sera needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, and chicken for her business. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her family house. Sera has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, and chicken.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en:
This is Agape group consisting of 12 members. In 2008, these hard working tribal women came together as a group to help one another to empower themselves and improve their earning capacity. They belong to Kholep Village in Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. 

Lhingneikim, who is raising her hand in the photo, is one of the group members. She is 42 years old and lives with her three daughters, one son and her husband. Her husband is 47 years old. He drives a van on a hire basis and all her children are getting a good education in a private school, which is about 4 km in distance from her village. Her husband's income alone cannot support the family, so they are dependent on her business. 
 
She took a previous loan of INR 5,000 and with this loan she bought two piglets and yarn for weaving shawls and wrap-arounds. With much struggle and hard work, she was able to pay off her first loan. In this way, she contributed to the family income. With that loan and sale proceeds from two of her full-grown pigs, she bought a handloom (a simple machine to weave) to increase weaving in terms of production. Her daughters assisted her by selling door to door after school and on holidays. 
  
Now she needs another loan to expand her weaving activities. She hopes to get a good price for the grown pigs with the festival coming ahead. With this money and the money from the loan, she plans to repair her weaving loom and to buy one more handloom to increase her production double fold. She is happy and wishes good fortune to all the lenders around the world so that they may continue their kindness to helpless people like her and extends her warm greetings on behalf of the group. “Happy Thanksgiving for you and your family”.

loans.use: to repair her weaving loom and buy a new one

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en: Mwanarusi always dreams of being a prominent woman who is responsible in the community. She wants to have a prosperous future at some time and to ensure that her children do not lack any basic needs. She is a single mother of three children who are attending school. For the past 10 years, Mwanarusi has been operating a fish selling business, selling from her home. She is a very open-minded lady who believes in efforts and determination. She has regular customers due to her high quality fish and good service. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hiyari

texts.en: Hiyari, 24, is a mother of two children who are three and seven years old. She is married and lives with her family in the rural part of the outskirts of the town of Msambweni. Three years ago, Hiyari opened a coconut-selling business and she has been running it successfully. She is a woman with many entrepreneurial skills. She has gained much experience and she now knows her customer needs very well. She is happy to feel responsible for the house since she helps her husband with the household expenses. Currently, her stock of coconuts has gone down and she wants to increase it. However, she lacks enough capital to do so. She is, therefore, asking for a loan to buy more pieces of coconut to sell..

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi, 42, is a married woman and mother of five children. She has been involved in a food vending business making and selling dumplings. She sells her dumplings door to door to her neighbors. She is a well-known person in the village due to her quality products and her kindness. Mwanamkasi says that her business needs a lot of devotion and determination. At times, she walks to the neighboring villages to sell her products. She wants to buy ingredients but she does not have working capital. This is why she asked Yehu for a loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder. She has faith that she will one day run a hotel.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: Mwanamvua is married to Hassan who is a businessman. She is a 36-year-old woman and the mother of five. She lives with her family in the rural area of Msambweni, in the coastal region of Kenya. For the past five years, Mwanamvua has been running a milk-selling business. In addition to this business, she also sells fish during the afternoon hours. Her goal is move forward in life but the main challenge is the high prices of commodities and lack of enough capital to invest in her business. However, she is optimistic and she is sure that this investment from the loan she is currently asking for will help her grow her businesses. She plans to buy more milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Antonia Marta

texts.es: La señora Antonia Marta
texts.en: Antonia Marta

loans.use: to buy materials for blouses

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. María sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de patasca que es una sopa tradicional de las zonas alto andinas. Proviene del quechua phatasqa, que significa reventado o partido, porque la elaboración está lista cuando en el hervor el maíz se abre. Es una poderosa sopa de alto nivel nutritivo, por el concentrado de las vísceras de res, la cabeza del carnero, las papas, habas, maíz y demás especias, cuenta que le fue bien con el credito ya que lo utilizo en la construccion de un techo para su puesto de venta, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como maiz al por mayor para la elaboracion de su riquisima patasca.
texts.en: María continues to sell patasca, a soup traditional to the high-Andean zones. It comes from the Quechan "phatasqa", which means burst or split, because it is ready when the maize boils and opens. It is a strong soup of high nutritional value due to the concentrate of animal entrails, ram's head, potatoes, maize, and other things. She says she went well with the previous loan as she used it to construct a roof for her stall. This time she is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of food such as maize for making her delicious patasca.

loans.use: to wholesale purchase food such as maize for making her delicious patasca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is 74 years old and married, with 11 children.

She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, and other items that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years.

Tu needs a loan to buy tools for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Tu will use the profits from her sales to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knife, fertilizer, and shovels.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: EL señor Juan es felizmente casado, padre de 2 hermosos niños, ejemplar en sus obligaciones y visionario del futuro familiar, es profesional obstenta la especialidad de licenciatura  en Biología, labora como maestro de secundaria en un colegio Rural de la comunidad donde habita, solicita un crédito a ceprodel para mejorar las condiciones de la pulpería  y tener otros ingresos para el desarrollo económico del hogar, ya que el mismo lo utilizara para la compra de Frezzer, Balanza de Reloj, Estante, Arroz  a Granel, Aceite, Frijol, Azúcar a Granel, Jabón Ristra y Carne de Pollo, para darle mejor formalidad a la imagen y condiciones de su negocio, el que lo administra su esposa y los momentos libres él, ya que tiene un carisma Amable y emprendedor.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is happily married and is father of 2 beautiful children.  He is exemplary in his obligations and visionary of the family's future. As a professional he holds a degree in Biology.  He works as a secondary school teacher at a local rural school where he lives.

He is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL to improve the conditions of the grocery store, and to have other income for the economic development of his home; this is so, as he will use it to buy a freezer, a clock scale, shelving, rice Granel, oil, beans, sugar Granel, soap Ristra and chicken meat.  All this is to give a more formal image and conditions the the business. The grocery store is managed by his wife, and when he has a free moment he does it because of his enterprising and kind charisma.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a clock scale, shelving, rice Granel, oil, beans, soap Ristra and chicken meat.

loans.name: Román Salvador

texts.es:
El señor Román a la edad de cincuenta y un años labora de guarda de seguridad en una institución del estado,
Es casado y padre de tres hijos a su cargo. 

está solicitando crédito para compra de cemento, arena, zinc, madera así como para el pago de mano de obra.

Ha demostrado ser una persona honesta y que cumple con sus compromisos adquiridos.

A la vez agradece a personas que hacen posible el sueño de todo ser humano como lo es de tener un techo digno para su familia, el cual es fruto de su trabajo y buenas costumbres valores que son herencia de sus padres.
texts.en:
Román is 51 years old and works as a security guard in a state institution. He is married and has four children to support.

He is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, corrugated iron, and wood, as well as to pay for labor.

He has shown himself to be an honest person who fulfills his obligations.

He is grateful to the people who make the dream, common to all mankind, of providing a decent roof for his family a reality. This dream is the fruit of his labor and the good habits and values inherited from his parents.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as sand, cement, stone, and gravel.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Ángela María  tiene 60 años de edad. Vive en el municipio Chichigalpa,  conocido por su producción de caña de azúcar y licorera. Es uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.

La Señora Ángela María  es viuda, su esposo murió  hace 1 año de  infección renal crónica, conocida comúnmente como “creatinina” el trabajo desde  su niñez en corte de caña de azúcar, riego y labores de campo. 
Al ser diagnosticado con esta, enfermedad a pesar de ser un hombre aun fuerte  no lo contratan para evitar gastos médicos.

Actualmente, la Señora vive de la cosecha de una platanera que le dejo su esposo, su hijo mayor es quien la apoya en el manejo y cuido de la plantación de 1.5 mz. y con la cual se mantienen 3 familias; ella tiene un hijo quien nació con problemas de parálisis cerebral  y depende exclusivamente de los cuidados de la Señora  Ángela María.

Ella se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los días a realizar sus labores cotidianas y posteriormente se dedica al cuido de su hijo quien pasa  en cama y cuando la señora va ayudar a la limpieza del cultivo lo llevan en una silla para estar a la vista de la señora. 

El destino del crédito es para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes y fungicidas, para cubrir gastos del manejo del cultivo de plátano.

La Señora Ángela María  agradece a CEPRODEL y Kiva ya que de esta manera está mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia y pide que se les siga apoyando para que todas las personas que sufren de esta enfermedad sean apoyados.
texts.en:
Sra. Angela Maria is 60 years old. She lives in the town of Chichigalpa, well known for its production of sugar cane and its alcohol industry. It is one of the hottest places in Nicaragua.

Sra. Angela Maria is a widow. Her husband died one year ago from a chronic kidney infection involving high levels of creatinine. From childhood, he worked cutting sugar cane, irrigating the fields and doing general farm labor. Upon being diagnosed with this 
disease, despite still being a strong man, he was not hired to avoid medical expenses.

Currently, the Señora lives from the harvest of a banana farm that her husband left her. Her oldest son is the person who helps her manage and care for the plantation of 1.5 manzanas (1 manzana equals 1.73 acres), which supports three families. She also has a son who was born with cerebral palsy and who is completely dependent on her care.

She gets up at 4 in the morning every day to perform her daily tasks and later takes care of her son who is bedridden. When she goes to help weed the plantation, she takes her son with her in a chair so she can always keep him in view.

She will use the loan to purchase supplies such as fertilizers and fungicides in order to cover the costs of managing the banana farm.

Sta. Angela Maria is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva because this is how she is improving her quality of life and that of her family and she asks that they continue supporting her so that all the people who suffer from cerebral palsy will be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides for her banana farm.

loans.name: Evelyn Jeaneth

texts.es:
Evelyn, solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras frescas, por ejemplo comprara manzanas, papayas, fresas, cebollas, tomates, pepinos, y otras mas que son de necesidad en el mercado para atender  a los clientes.
Comenta Evelyn que el préstamo que se le brindo anteriormente, le sirvió mucho, realizo una buena compra de frutas y verduras, manteniéndose en el mercado.
texts.en:
Evelyn is requesting a loan for the purchase of fresh fruit and vegetables. For example, she will buy apples, papayas, strawberries, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and others, which are needed in the market to serve her customers.

Evelyn comments that the loan that was previously provided to her helped her a lot. She made a good purchase of fruits and vegetables, supporting herself in the market.

loans.use: to buy apples, papayas, strawberries, onions, tomatoes, and cucumbers.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña María del Rosario, reside en la cuidad de Masaya, también conocida como la capital del Folklore Nicaragüense.

 Tiene la edad de 52 años, casada, tiene seis hijos cinco mayores de edad e independientes y una menor de edad, que es por quien trabaja arduamente para apoyarla en su educación.
 
Ella es comerciante desde hace 6 años, decidió crear su propia forma de ingreso debido a la situcion económica de nuestro país , manifiesta que comenzó con capital propio y que gracias a Dios ha ido aumentando , ella posee una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación vende  los 7 días de la semana, Porque sus clientes así se lo demandan, ofrece productos de uso cotidiano como es el alimento.

Actualmente quieren aumentar su negocio por lo que solicita a ceprodel  un crédito con el que pueda comprar los siguientes productos arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijol, huevo, carbón, leche nido, jabón extra, desodorante, sardinas, ace, marucha y pamper. 

"Expresa que este crédito le permitirá crecer y ofrecer más productos a su cliente, lo cual es importante para ella porque así mantendrá  satisfecho a sus clientes en la que podrán encontrar siempre los producto deseado".
texts.en:
María del Rosadio lives in the city of Masays, also known as the capital of Nicaraguan folklore.

She is 52 years old, married, and has six children, five of which are adults and independent and one minor, for whom she works arduously to support her in her education.

She has been a merchant for six years. She decided to create her own form of income owing to the economic situation of our country. She states that she began with her own capital, and thankfully has increased. She possesses a local store situated in her home. She is open seven days a week, because her customers demand it, and she offers everyday products such as food.

Presently, she wants to increase her business, for which she is applying for a loan from Ceprodel, with which she can buy the following products: rice, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, charcoal, Nido milk, Extra soap, deodorant, sardines, Ace laundry detergent, and Pampers diapers.

“She says that this loan will allow her to grow and offer more products to her customers, which is important to her because in this way she will maintain the satisfaction of her customers in that they will always be able to find their desired product.”

loans.use: for the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, charcoal, Nido milk, Extra soap, deodorant, sardines, Ace laundry detergent, Maruchan soups, and Pampers diapers.

loans.name: Jhimmy

texts.es:
Jhimmy no es casado pero convive con su pareja y tiene un hijo de dos años que aun no esta en la escuela, vive en casa de sus padres y ocupa cinco habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo, revocado de estuco y piso de tablones. La casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como transportista público, el es el único que provee a su familia ya que la esposa no trabaja y solamente se dedica a su hogar. Es la unica actividad que tiene y por lo tanto el único ingreso.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor para su movilidad para poder continuar con su actividad y así poder cumplir con su trabajo. 
El sueño de Jhimmy es poder adquirir otra movilidad y poder tener un ingreso mas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Jhimmy is not married, but he lives with his partner and has a 2 year-old son who is not yet in school.  He lives in his parents' house, occupying 5 rooms with brick walls that are plastered with stucco and wooden floors.  The home is located in the Tembladerani neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Jhimmy currently works in public transportation.  This is his family's only source of income, because his wife doesn't work and devotes herself only to the home. This is the only economic activity he has, and so is his only source of income.

Jhimmy needs a loan to buy a motor for his vehicle, so that he can continue to work and carry out his job.

Jhimmy's dream is to be able to acquire another vehicle, so that he could have more income and improve his quality of life.

This is the second time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 37 años vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace muchos años. Hace 3 años se viene dedicando a la crianza de  animales de ganado vacuno, se inicio por medio de un préstamo la cual ha sabido invertirlo, también tiene ovejas  y adicionado a esto siembra  alfalfa para alimentarlos y su crianza sea mas ventajosa en sus ganancias, cuenta con el apoyo de sus  hijos en las tareas del campo, en la extracción de la alfalfa de los campos de cultivos, para ella es muy importante que sus animales estén saludables y eso se logra a través de una buena alimentación, esto la ayudara para tener una buena venta de sus animales en la feria ganadera. Marlene quiere aumentar la cantidad de animales que posee para que su capital de trabajo se incremente. Tiene varios años trabajando de manera grupal en el banco comunal “productores huancas” y este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión ella sigue renovando su esfuerzo y su actitud positiva. Marlene, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada por cantidad para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Marlene is 37 years old and lives with her three sons in the house she inherited from her parents many years ago.

For the past three years she has been breeding cattle. She got started in it through a loan, which she has invested well.  She also has sheep and has added the cultivation of alfalfa to feed them and turn more advantageous profits from breeding.  

She counts with the support of her sons to work the fields and harvesting of the alfalfa.  It is very important to her that her animals be healthy, which is possible through a good nutrition. This will help her sales at the cattle fair.  

Marlene wants to increase the number of animals she owns so that her working capital grows.  She has been a member of the communal bank "productores huancas" for several years, and this will be her 6th loan with MFP.  

Her perseverance is admirable as she is one of the members with the longest history in the group.  She continues to renew her efforts and positive attitude.

Marlene will invest the money to buy wholesale balanced food to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for her animals

loans.name: Ronilo

texts.en:
Ronilo is a 29-year-old resident of Gata Daku, Clarin.  He helps his family meet its needs from the modest amount of PHP 7,000 that he gains monthly from his gardening business, now five years old. 

However, this year, he has become a member of GDMPC, and he has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of PHP 14,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Ronilo wants to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Faalo

texts.en:
Faalo is 18 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Faalo has requested a loan to buy pork, salt, onions, flour, cooking oil, and an oven. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faalo will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: To buy pork, salt, onionis, cooking oil and a new oven.

loans.name: Faataualofa

texts.en:
Faataualofa  is a 54-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Faataualofa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, veggie seeds, shovels, an axe and sprayers. She just became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Faataualofa hopes to help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: To buy veggie seeds, shovels, weed killer and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old and is married. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, she joined GDMPC. Nelly is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his moptorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, quiere mejorar en su taller y su negocio de la venta de chatarra, él comprara mas chatarra de los clientes como  latas, hierro, botellas plásticas, entre otros materiales que Juan recicla, este financiamiento le ayudara para la compra.
Con el crédito anterior considera que le sirvió en su negocio, de la ganancias pudo mejorar su vehículo en el cual transporta la mercadería, ha tenido más oportunidades de venta en este tiempo, y sus ingresos al hogar se han mantenido mejor.
texts.en:
Juan wants to improve his workshop and his business selling scraps. He will buy more scraps from his customers like cans, iron, plastic bottles and other materials that Juan recycles. This loan will help him to make those purchases.

He thinks that the previous loan was helpful to his business - with the profits he was able to make repairs to the vehicle he uses to transport his merchandise. During this time he has had more sales opportunities and his income has allowed his household to live better.

loans.use: to buy cans, iron, plastic bottles.

loans.name: Dayssy Del Rosario

texts.es:
Dayssy, vive con su hijo de 14 años de edad y con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos, este negocio lo realiza desde hace 3 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mariscos en general, pescado, langostas, camarones, conchas, que le permitirán mejorar el negocio y sus ganancias.
Su aspiración es mejorar el inventario y tener más capacidad para las ventas.
texts.en:
Dayssy lives with her husband and 14 year old son.  She works selling seafood.  She has had this business for three years.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase seafood in general including fish, lobster, shrimp, and conch, which will allow her to improve her business and her income.  

Her aspiration is to improve her inventory and have more capacity for sales.

loans.use: to purchase fish, lobster, shrimp, and conch.

loans.name: Onosai

texts.en:
Onosai is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. 

Onosai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, veggie seeds, shovels, an axe and sprayers. She just became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Onosai hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy veggie seeds, gloves, chemicals, a wheel barrow and weed killer.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is a 44-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Nive has requested a loan to buy chemicals, veggie seeds, shovels, an axe, sprayers and a wheelbarrow. She just became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Nive hopes to renew her house.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, veggie seeds, shovels, an axe and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 24-year-old resident of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. Elvira supports her four children's needs from the little amount of PHP 3,000 she has gained monthly from her gardening business for the last three years. 

However since 2011 she's been a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of PHP 6,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Elvira wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ake

texts.en: Ake is a 43-year-old married woman with 9 children. She makes and sells banana chips and taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Ake needs a loan to buy goods and equipment for her business. She plans to use her profits to provide her family's daily needs. Ake has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro, salt, oil, and flavorings.

loans.name: Oneyda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Oneyda  originaria de Estelí, con  36 años de edad, madre de 2 hijo, de oficio comerciante. Ella se dedica  a una pulpería de la que es propietaria hace 10 años. Inicio trabajando con su mama en la pulpería, ya que después su mama le  heredo  la pulpería  a la edad de 25 años, este ha sido su primer  negocio, comercializa sus productos en la misma comarca donde habita.
Ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar aceite etc.  Quiere diversificar su negocio con ventas de ropa como pantalones, blusas y zapatos.  Considerando que al comprar  este tipo de producto, de alta demanda aumentaría la cantidad de sus clientes y podrá vender mas incrementando sus ganancias, ya que se acerca la temporada navideña en donde la demanda de sus productos crece, sus meta es invertir mas en su pulpería para comprar mas producto y asi poder ofrecer variedad  y calidad  de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Oneyda is originally from Esteli. She is 36 years old, mother of two sons and a shopkeeper.  She is dedicated to a convenience store of which she has been the owner for the past 10 years.  She got started working the convenience store with her mother.  After she inherited the store from her mother at the age of 25, this has been her first business.  She does business in the same area where she lives.  

She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains like rice, sugar, oil, etc. She wants to diversify her business by selling clothing such as pants, blouses and shoes.  Considering that this type of product is of high demand, her clientele will increase and she will be able to sell more, increasing her profits; also Christmas season approaches and this is when the demand for her products grows. 

Her goal is to increase her investment in the store, to buy more products and be able to offer variety and quality products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil and basic grains like rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand and firewood to bake bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure, insecticides and pesticides for tending his crops.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Kinuman, Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Rebecca is married and has five children. To make a living, Rebecca raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. Rebecca been in her farming for 11 years and earns 5,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Rebecca joined GDMPC. Rebecca is requesting a loan of 11,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Selafina

texts.en: Selafina is 26 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Selafina has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, onions, soy sauce, coconuts, and a stove. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Selafina will help out with her family's weekly financial needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, onions, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a 59-year-old married mom of five children. She lives in Lapasan, Clarin. 

She has been sewing for 12 years and continues to do so today. Every month she receives PHP 8,000, which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses. Leonisa joined Gata Daku MPC in 2008. 

She is applying for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy another set of sewing machine. By all this means, Leonisa hopes to create as much output as she can to have more income.

loans.use: to buy another set of sewing machine.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es:
Ramón, por la necesidad de invertir en su labor agrícola, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, que son los necesarios para que él de los cuidados necesarios a su cultivo.
El préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener lo más necesario para trabajar, sus condiciones económicas en la familia han sido mas favorables.
texts.en:
Ramón needs to invest in his farm, so he is requesting a new loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide, which are necessary for him to care for his crops.  

His last loan allowed him to grow and have more necessary items to do his work.  His family's financial condition has been very favorable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita dinero para invertir en la instalacion de  pupuseria, ya que tiene el objeto de que estos fondos le sirvan para comprar una plancha pupusera, con esto Sandra mejorara el negocio.
La aspiración de ella es fortalecer el negocio, aumentar su clientela, considera que con el préstamo que utilizo anteriormente, su situación económica mejoro, en su familia todos se encuentran bien.
texts.en:
Sandra has decided on a new loan, because she needs money to invest in equipment for her business making pupusas [traditional filled tortillas]. Her aim is for these funds to allow her to buy a griddle to make pupusas. With this, Sandra will be able to improve her business. 

Her aspiration is to strengthen her business and expand her customer base. She believes that with the loan she used previously, her economic situation improved. Everyone in her family is now doing well.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make pupusas.

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es:
Freddy labora como guía de turistas en un prestigioso hotel de las bellas playas del pacifico de Nicaragua además de conducir un tren donde se trasladan los huésped a los diversos puntos de recreación que brinda dicho centro turístico.

Es padre de cuatro hijos a su cargo y solicita crédito para compra de arena, cemento y piedra triturada para la mejora de su vivienda.

Es conocido como una persona respetuosa y honrada por lo que se gana la confianza de los clientes por su atención, recibiendo de esta forma otros ingresos adicionales en sus jornadas laborales. Los cuales se ven reflejada en una mejoría económica y familiar.
texts.en:
Freddy is a tourist guide at a prestigious hotel in the beautiful beaches of Nicaragua.  In addition he operates a train, which hotel guests use as transportation between the recreational areas the hotel offers.

He is father to four sons in his care and is asking for a loan to buy sand, cement and gravel to improve his house.  
He is known for being polite and honest, which is why he gains the trust and attention of his clients, allowing him to earn additional income during his daily job. This is reflected in economic and family betterment.

loans.use: to buy building material such as cement, sand, gravel, wood and labor.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en: Jessel is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 36 years old and is married with 3 children. Jessel operates a specialized retail store as a source of income. For 5 years, Jessel has run this store and gets 5,000 PHP monthly. Last year, 2011, Jessel joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more shampoo, soaps, and other items to sell. Jessel hopes to get adequate income from this investment so she can sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more shampoo, soaps, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is 21 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community. She has been doing this for 2 years. Dora has requested a loan to buy taro, bananas, deep pots, cooking oil, salt and an oven. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Dora will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy taro, bananas, deep pots, cooking oil, salt, and an oven to make chips.

loans.name: Juana Iris

texts.es:
Juana, quiere mejorar el negocio, reinvirtiendo en prendas de vestir, blusas, faldas, camisas, ropa interior, calcetas y pantalones, además quiere de ser posible con este préstamo complementar la compra de una moto.
Con el préstamo anterior ha logrado comprar mercadería para mantenerse en el negocio, realizando movimiento en su inventario, su hogar comenta que se ha mantenido, ha realizado mejoras a la vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana wants to improve her business by reinvesting in apparel such as blouses, skirts, shirts, underwear, socks and pants. She also wants to be able to supplement the purchase of a motorcycle with this loan. 

With the previous loan, Juana has managed to purchase merchandise to stay in business and is selling her inventory. She says her home has been maintained, and she has made improvements to her housing.

loans.use: purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, underwear, socks and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase quinoa in bulk for making his quinoa and apple juices.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque recibió una buena atención, además necesita realizar la compra de mercadería para la tienda, como sodas, jugos, gatorade, entre otras más que son necesarias para fortalecer el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior él considera que su negocio aumento la mercadería, sus ganancias han sido mayores porque sus clientes demandaron de sus productos, en su familia están todos sus miembros.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan because he received good attention. Also, he needs a loan to purchase the merchandise for the shop, such as soda, juice, Gatorade, and other things that are necessary to sustain the business. 

With the previous loan he things that his business grew the merchandise. His earnings have been large because his clients demanded his products. In this family are all his members.

loans.use: to purchase soda, juice, and Gatorade.

loans.name: Asonei

texts.en: Asonei is a 21 year-old married woman.  She has two children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Asonei has requested a loan to buy veggie seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers.  She just became a member of SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) this year.  With her profits, Asonei hopes to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, weed killer, .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of coco lumber to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es:
Ana, quiere invertir en el negocio, a través de un nuevo préstamo que le permita invertir en la granja de pollos que realiza, se comprara 200 pollos de engorde, para aprovechar la temporada que se acerca en la que deberá tenerlos con un peso adecuado para la venta, comenta que el préstamo anterior pudo cancelarlo debido a la venta de todos los pollos que tenia.
Con el préstamo anterior manifiesta que incremento la granja y sus ganancias, gracias a la inversión del crédito ha mejorado su económica.
texts.en:
Ana wants to invest in her business, and plans to use the support from this loan to strengthen her chicken farm by purchasing 200 broiler chickens for resale. She hopes to have them fattened up in time for the upcoming holiday season, and hopes to receive a good price for them. 

Ana was able to pay off her previous loan, since she sold all the chickens she was raising. She was able to leverage the support from that previous loan to expand her farm and profits, and she is very grateful for the support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase 200 broiler chickens for resale.

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en: Lauiula is a 56 year-old married woman. She has nine children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Lauiula has requested a loan to buy veggie seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, and sprayers. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) this year. With her profits, Lauiula hopes to pay for her children's school fees next year.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, weed killer, gloves.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en: Terry is a 30 year-old woman who is married and has four children. She runs a business selling food and local goods  in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Terry has requested a loan to buy more goods to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy clothes, soap, shoes, salt, flour, twistees, lollies..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Jessica Nohemy

texts.es:
Jessica, vive con sus padres, la vivienda es propia, no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta perfumería y enchape, este negocio tiene dos años de estarlo atendiendo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para poderse comprar prendas enchapadas como aretes, pulseras, tambien un surtido de perfumería para hombres y mujeres, esto le ayudara para que la variedad en el negocio mejore.
Su aspiración es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad, para que su negocio sea más productivo e incremente sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessica doesn't have any children, and she lives with her parents in the home that they own. She sells perfume and plated chains, and she has been doing this business for two years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy plated pieces like earrings and bracelets, as well as an assortment of perfumes for men and women, which will help the selection in her business improve. 

Juana's aspiration is to have a shop in the city center, so that her business will be more productive and her profits will increase.

loans.use: purchase earrings, bracelets, and perfumes.

loans.name: Faafofola

texts.en: Faafofola is 38 years old.  She is married and has four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flours, oil, sugar, gas oven, large tin bowl, baking powder.  In the future, Faafofola hopes to improve her business to help her kids' educations and her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, baking soda,

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, 44, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her partner is Efren, a welder, and they have a child. Rosemarie, together with her partner, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosemarie operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosemarie hopes that her business will expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bernardo Nicolas

texts.es:
El señor Bernardo  tiene 51 años de edad. Vive en el municipio Chichigalpa, un lugar cercano a compañía Licorera de Nicaragua, conocido por su producción de caña de azúcar y licorera. Es uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.

Desde hace 2 años le fue diagnosticado con infección renal crónica, conocida comúnmente como “creatinina” el trabajo desde  su niñez en corte de caña de azúcar, riego y labores de campo.

Al ser diagnosticado con esta enfermedad, a pesar de ser un hombre aun fuerte  no lo contratan para evitar gastos médicos.
 
Actualmente en sus controles médicos le están solicitando realice Hemodiálisis, la cual se rehúsa a hacerla, ya que dice que  esto lo va a matar más rápido y no quiere dejar sola a su esposa quien es su única compañía.

El se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los días a realizar sus labores cotidianas y posteriormente se dedica a la venta y cuando puede salir, ayuda e a su esposa a cobrar los pagos pendientes de su esposa.

El destino del crédito es para cubrir gastos familiares e invertir en el negocio en la compra de  ropa, dulces, y cosméticos.

El señor Bernardo  agradeciendo a CEPRODEL y Kiva ya que de esta manera está mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia y pide que se les siga apoyando para que todas las personas que sufren de esta enfermedad sean apoyados.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 51 years old. He lives in the municipality of Chichigalpa, a place close to the Nicaragua Liquor Company, which is known for its production of sugar cane and spirits. Chichigalpa is also one of the hottest place in Nicaragua.

Two years ago, Bernardo was diagnosed with a chronic kidney infection, commonly known as “creatinina,” or creatinine, from his childhood of harvesting sugar cane, irrigation, and fieldwork. Being diagnosed with this illness, no one will hire him in order to avoid medical expenses, despite the fact that he is a strong man still. Currently, during his medical examinations, they are asking Bernardo to do hemodialysis, which he has refused, because he says it will kill him faster, and he doesn't want to leave his only companion, his wife, all alone. 

Bernardo wakes up at 6 in the morning everyday to do his daily chores, and then he conducts his sales business. When he can leave, he helps his wife collect her outstanding payments. This loan is to cover family expenses and to invest in his business through the purchase of clothes, sweets and cosmetics. 

Bernardo is grateful to CEPRODEL and KIVA, because his and his family’s quality of life is improving, and he calls for their continued support so that everyone who suffers from this disease will be supported.

loans.use: purchase clothes, sweets and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to resell

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, adquiriendo ropa en variedad para niños, adultos, tambien lociones, ya que su negocio le permitirá en esta temporada poder generar mejores ventas.
Con el préstamo anterior Ana ayudo a incrementar la mercadería, este mismo objetivo busca con este préstamo, en su familia su condición se mantiene, el número de miembros es igual.
texts.en:
Ana decided to apply for a loan in order to invest in her business and purchase clothing for adults, children, and to purchase lotions for resale. The upcoming sale season is typically more profitable, and Ana hopes to take advantage of this opportunity.

Ana was able to leverage the support from her previous loan to increase her merchandise stock, and she plans to invest the funds from this loan similarly. Her family is in a stable condition, and has the same number of members as when she applied for her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase body lotions and a variety of clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock and introduce additional items such as meat and dairy to her store.

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Pisey (in the photo) is a weaver and her husband is a farmer. In addition, she also assists in her husband’s farming. They have two young children and they have one young son. 

Pisey had asked and used her previous loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide (www.kiva.org/lend/354738).
 
She hopes to continue her farming business. That’s why she applied for another loan in the amount of $1,000. She will also use a part of the loan to buy water pumping chine to spray her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in the photo) and her husband, Hay, are wedding caterers. In addition, they supplement their income with a new fruit selling business. They buy mangoes from her fellow villagers under contract. This means that they pay money before the harvesting season and then they collect mangoes to sell. 

Touch had asked and used her previous loan to assist in her wedding catering business by buying food on credit, and then after the wedding she will reimburse the food venders (www.kiva.org/lend/404775).

She is now applying for second Kiva loan of $500 to buy more mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes under contract, for resale after the harvest.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Don Pedro es originario del municipio de Masaya,  soltero y tiene 66 años de edad, es propietario de su propio negocio desde hace 6 años, adquiriendo amplia experiencia como ingeniero civil, ofrece  servicios como lo es: el  diseño gráfico, impresiones, fotocopias y elaboración de planos topográficos.

Su núcleo familiar es de 2, don Pedro y una hija que tiene a su  cargo, quien es a quien apoya en sus   estudios.

Solicita a Ceprodel  un  crédito para la compra de materia prima, ya que en estos momentos  tiene pedidos para la elaboración de tarjetas a diferentes colegios de Masaya. 

Considera que este crédito le ayudara mejorar la calidad de su servicios, a incrementar sus ventas y adquirir nuevos clientes, ya que con el pretende adquirir nuevos equipos  y materiales.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is originally from the municipality of Masaya. He is 66 years old and single. He has had his own business for six years, acquiring wide experience as a civil engineer. He offers services such as: graphic design, prints, photocopies, and topographic maps. His nuclear family numbers two: Don Pedro and his daughter, whom he helps with her studies.

He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to purchase raw materials, since at the moment he has orders for cards from various schools in Masaya. He thinks this loan will help him to improve the quality of his services, increase his sales, and gain new clients, since with it he will try to get new equipment and material.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a monitor, a scanner, and a coil binding machine for brochures.

loans.name: Celia Emelina

texts.es:
Celia, necesita mas capital para su trabajo, que le permita continuar realizando la venta, comprándose leña, maíz, aceite, frijoles, para la preparación de tamales de gallina y de frijol, por eso solicita un préstamo que le brinde con los recursos prestados la seguridad de continuar en el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior, ella logro comprarse materiales para fortalecer el negocio, con sus ventas ha logrado recibir ganancias para ayudar a su familia, todas las condiciones en su familia han estado estables.
texts.en:
Celia needs more capital in order to buy firewood, corn, oil, and beans for preparing chicken tamales and bean tamales, which she sells. For this reason she is requesting a loan, which will give her the security to continue with the business.

With the previous loan she managed to buy materials to strengthen the business. She received profits from the sales that allowed her to help her family; her family conditions have been stable.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, oil, and beans.

loans.name: Duoc

texts.en:
Duoc was born in 1975. She has three children. The oldest, a daughter, is 7 years old. Her two sons are a 6-year-old boy and a 1-year-old boy. Her husband and she have a grocery store to earn a living. Duoc also works as a farmer to earn more money for her family. Her income is about 4,000,000 dong (VND). Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Duoc has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND, and she repaid the loan on time.
