Wangninnou Ives' education stopped with elementary school. He lives together with his children and his wife. Together, the couple sees to the various household expenses.

It was 10 years ago that Wangninnou Ives began to work as a miller from his home. He undertakes his business with passion, which allows him to meet his needs and those of his children. He gets his supplies in a town in Benin.

With the goals of customer satisfaction and increasing his working capital, Wangninnou Ives is seeking a fifth loan. This loan will allow him to better respond to customer demand and to make more of a profit. The preceding loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marcelline est âgée de 40 ans. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Marcelline et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Marcelline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de huit ans que Marcelline vend des produits vivriers son domicile. Marcelline exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Marcelline s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Marcelline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les prêts antérieurs reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Jesukpego Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Marcelline, is 40 years old. The couple [she and her husband] have two children, both in school and one of whom remains in their care. Marcelline and her husband live together with their children and, together, see to the various household expenses.

Marcelline did not attend school. She has been selling foodstuffs from her home for nearly eight years. Marcelline undertakes her business with passion, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies in the regions of Benin.

With the goal of customer satisfaction, Marcelline, along with the other members of the Jesukpego Group, is seeking a fifth loan from Alidé. This loan will allow them to better meet customer demand and to make more of a profit. The preceding loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Gwladys Elingnan's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Agée de 32ans, Gwladys la responsable est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 18ans et 13ans. Gwladys vend des mèches et des pagnes depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Dans le but d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Gwladys se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of two women who are mutually guaranteeing their loan. Gwladys, the group's leader, is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children attending school. The eldest is 18 and [the youngest is] 13 years old.

Gwladys has been selling hair extensions and pagnes [traditional cloths] for several years and gets her supplies in one of the outdoor markets. With the goal of increasing her stock capacity and fulfilling her clients' expectations, she has sought and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev in order to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's education. Gwladys appears at left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase 10 pagnes [traditional cloths] and 20 [sets of] hair extensions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 50 years old, married and the mother of three children. She sells fruits and vegetables as well as other commodities, such as groundnuts, in Malindi for a living and earns a monthly income of about KES 6,050. Eunice was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

She has applied for a loan of KES 21,000 to purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. The anticipated income will help improve her family's living standards as she will be able to help pay her children's school fees. 

Eunice intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will own a well-established retail shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is a resident of Kilifi, Kenya. He is a single businessman who transports goods and people using a motorcycle, a business that he has run for one year. Erastus learnt of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings which he will combine with his savings to purchase another motorcycle. 

The only challenges in his business are the high cost of spare parts and fluctuating fuel prices. However, Erastus is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to purchase a public service vehicle (mini-bus).

loans.use: To combine with his savings to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 39 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Violeta runs a general store (sari-sari store) in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Violeta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married businessman who transports goods and people with a motorcycle, a business that he has run for four years. He also owns a butcher's shop. 

Ali learnt about Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to increase the stock in his butcher's shop and repair his motorcycle. 

The only challenge in his businesses is high competition. However, Ali is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that it is from such ventures that he can support his family. His future ambition is to be able to purchase a public service vehicle (mini-bus).

loans.use: To increase the stock in his butcher's shop and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has been running a sewing business for many years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Sakina’s husband. Her husband is a well-known tailor in their community and works seven days a week to support his family and to provide education for his children. He is an experienced tailor who has been working for the past 15 years and Sakina assists him in completing orders quickly.  

Sakina is a good client of Kashf Foundation and is in her second loan cycle. The couple wishes to expand their business in commercial areas and need a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase a new sewing machine with packs of buttons, laces and reels of threads in various colors. Sakina is hopeful that this will boost her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits by providing a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine with packs of buttons, laces and reels of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia previously accessed a loan of 16,000 PHP that she used to purchase more candies, biscuits and other products needed in her business. Her earnings through this loan were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy candies, biscuits and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better her profit. Gaudencia's profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gaudencia hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of biscuits, candies and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, firewood, salt and yeast.

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid is a 19-year-old man who lives with his mother. He has seven years of experience as a barber and decided to open his own shop in his town as he knows its entire population and most of them are really close to him.
 
Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner, V.F. AzerCredit, to improve his home’s condition. Farid is not ready to have a family until he’s financially established and able to cover all their needs: he’s trying his best to develop his work and to enlarge his income.

loans.use: To improve his home’s condition.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a widowed mother of one child.  Jane owns a grocery, a business that she has been running for six years. Besides this, she also sells dried fish.

Jane learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. 
 
She is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase foodstuffs like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, dried fish, etc. to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standard . She aspires to own a cafe in future.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, dried fish, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 47 years old and married with seven children. She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Matilde has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Matilde has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 63 años, hace más de 30 años quedó viuda. Vive con hija en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito agrícola. Marcelina es una mujer trabajadora. Se dedica a la atención de su cafetín y kiosco desde hace más de 30 años. Con la ayuda de su fallecido esposo levantaron el negocio, donde empezaron ofreciendo comidas. Desde entonces ya se hizo conocida por su buena sazón y la amabilidad. Con el tiempo ella habilitó un espacio para ofrecer productos que los visitantes de otras ciudades llevan hacia sus hogares, como quesos, manjar blanco, frutas y otros comestibles. “Me gusta mi trabajo porque es relajado, pero para preparar los alimentos si dispongo más esfuerzo”, dice. Sus planes son fijos, continuar con su negocio, de tal manera que sus ahorros le permitan tener una vejez tranquila. Esta vez requiere de un apoyo para adquirir mercadería y trabajar con normalidad.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Huayounioc”, y éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP, donde es una socia responsable, porque paga sus cuotas responsablemente.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir mercadería como quesos frescos, manjar blanco, bizcochos, panes, además comprará ingredientes para preparar los alimentos que expende.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 63 years old. She was widowed nearly 30 years ago. She lives with a daughter in a house she owns located in a farming area. Marcelina is a hardworking woman. She has tended to her cafe and kiosk for more than 30 years. With the help of her deceased husband, she opened the business, where they began to offer meals. Since then, she became known for her good cooking and friendliness. Over time she set up a space to offer products that visitors from other cities take home such as cheeses, manjar blanco, fruit and other foods.“I like my work because it is relaxing, but to prepare the foods I do have to work harder," she says. Her plans are set: continue with her business in such a way that her savings allow her to have a calm old age. This time she requires some help to acquire merchandise and work normally. 

She belongs to the “Progreso Huayounioc” communal bank and this is her 9th loan with MFP. She is a responsible member because makes her payments on time. 

With the money, she will acquire  merchandise such as fresh cheese, manjar blanco, bizcochos, and breads. She will also buy ingredients to make the foods she sells.

loans.use: to buy fresh cheeses, manjar blanco, bizcochos, breads.

loans.name: David Martin

texts.es:
David, es soltero, vive con su familia, se dedica a las labores agrícolas, trabaja desde las 5:00am hasta la tarde, realizando la labor de quitar la maleza del cultivo.
El necesita un préstamo para realizar la inversión en la compra de abono, el cual deberá aplicar para que su cosecha sea abundante, que le ayudara a su bienestar.
El objetivo de David es a través del préstamo poder mejorar su calidad de vida y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
David is a single man who lives with his family. He works in agriculture. Each day, David begins work at 5 a.m. and works well into the afternoon, clearing weeds from his crops.
David needs this loan to invest in fertilizer to ensure a good harvest, which will help him make a living. David's goal is to use this loan to improve his quality of life and to help his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 46-year old married woman who has a successful stitching business. She has been in this line of work for six years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Parveen was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family; due to limited resources, none of their three sons were sent to school. Parveen felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home to meet the needs of the family members. She is a brave woman and her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty fulfilling large orders. For this she needs to have her daughter assist her in meeting orders on time. Therefore, she requested an loan of 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. Her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine, reels of thread and packs of buttons. This will allow her business to flourish, which will ultimately help in bringing in more cash. She dreams of providing her children with a high quality education for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, reels of thread and packs of buttons.

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan, es un agricultor, esta casado, tiene dos hijas de 10 y 12 años de edad, él comenzó su negocio como la via para obtener el sustento para él y su familia.
Actualmente esta realizando su cultivo, para ello solicita un préstamo porque deberá comprarse insumos agrícolas como abono y pesticidas, pues asi podrá ayudar a que su cultivo se desarrolle y prevenirlo de las plagas.
La aspiración de Juan es que su familia cuente con una fuente de ingreso para cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer. He is married and has two daughters, ages 10 and 12. Juan began his business as a way to support his family.
Right now, he is cultivating his crops and he is requesting this loan because he needs to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide. These will help his crops develop and help him prevent pests. 
Juan's goal is to have a steady source of income to cover all of his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in her basket weaving business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Maria Lourdes works hard to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Maria Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy more materials for basket weaving, such as buri and wicker. With this, she will be able to weave more baskets to sell in the market, thus augmenting her income.

In the future, Maria Lourdes hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more materials for basket weaving, such as buri and wicker.

loans.name: Ulyses

texts.en:
This is Ulyses. He previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase additional soft drinks needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for additional soft drinks needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ulyses hopes to expand his business in the coming years. He dreams of giving all of his children a high-quality education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks that he will sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a rope making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Maria is borrowing 22000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials for her rope making business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her rope making.

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
This is Cinderella, who previously accessed a 23,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Cinderella is now requesting a new loan for 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed in the store, the better for her business. More items to sell will result in greater profits, earnings that will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cinderella hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Delinda

texts.es:
Delinda, de  54 años, es una mujer alegre, soñadora y muy emprendedora. Vive junto a sus 02 hijos de 24 y 21 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando en la universidad y en sus ratos libres la ayudan a su mamá  en su negocio. El trabajo de Delinda consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, en ella vende golosinas, bebidas gasificadas, así también arroz, azúcar, plátano, carbón, galletas, caramelos. Éste trabajo lo realiza en un local que esta en el interior su propia vivienda. Lleva recién 13 años ejerciendo esta actividad y hasta el momento le esta yendo muy bien, logrando de esa manera crecer su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para estar a lado de sus hijos y puede ver su inversión de manera directa. Ella tiene muy buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene clientes, que son sus vecinos y personas que transitan por su calle.  Sin embargo, la zona donde vive, es un lugar que cada vez que llueve se inunda, por ello decidió rellenar su terreno, construir y ampliar el espacio para  su tienda,, así logrará una mejor atención a sus clientes. Ahora solo espera mantener su negocio y convertirse en el futuro en un Minimarket. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, tiene muchas ganas de seguir siendo una socia puntual. Además sabe que el grupo que conforma son muy responsables. Esta muy agradecida con la institución  ya que le dan la oportunidad de crecer como persona.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, lo utilizará para abastecer su negocio con arroz, plátano, carbón, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas, entre otros; ya que al comprar al por mayor reduce costos y se genera más ganancias.
texts.en:
Delinda, 54 years old, is a cheerful, idealistic, and enterprising woman. She lives with her two children, ages 24 and 21, who are currently studying in university, but they help their mother with her business in their free time. 

Delinda works selling essential items such as candies, carbonated beverages, rice, sugar, plátano (a banana-like food), charcoal, cookies, and caramels. She owns her own store attached to her home.  She has been running this store for 13 years now. So far, it has gone very well for Delinda, she has managed to grow her store over the years so that now, she has very good earnings. Delinda always has customers, either her neighbors or people traveling through the streets where she lives. However, Delinda's area is a place that floods each time it rains. So she decided to fill in her land, and build a wider space for her business so that she will be able to receive her customers better. Now, Delinda only hopes to maintain her business and turn it into a Minimarket in the future.

This is Delinda's 13th loan from MFP. She intends to continue being a punctual member of this group that she considers to be very responsible overall. Delinda is very grateful to this microfinance institution since it has given her the opportunity to grow as a person. With the loan of 2000 soles, she will stock her store with rice, plátano, charcoal, candies, carbonated beverages, and other items she buys in bulk to reduce her costs and generate more profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, plátano (a banana-like food), charcoal, candy, and carbonated drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a fifty-three-year-old single woman who has one child. She does farming in the outskirts of Limuru town and she has been in this business for twelve years now, getting a monthly income of about forty six thousand shillings.

This will be Margaret's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and also pay the people who help her on the farm. 

In future she wants to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 32-year-old woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in manicure and pedicure services for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy more materials for her manicure and pedicure business, such as nail polish, nail cutter, nipper and others. With this, she will be able to serve more customers, thus increasing her earnings.

In the future, Marilyn dreams of improving her livelihood and exploring another venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her manicure and pedicure business, such as nail polish, nail cutter, nipper and others.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is 47 years old and describes herself as a person who is hardworking, happy, generous and very responsible. She lives with her family: spouse and six children in the town of Msambweni.

Biasha dedicates herself to the sale of various dishes from her food stall. This work helps her support her family and cover the expenses of her children's education. For the moment, sales are good because of her charisma and friendliness. She requests a loan through Yehu in order to buy more ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.use: to buy corn and wheat flour, cooking fat, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with ten children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her vulcanizing shop. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Hanan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hanan, and it consists of 2 women and 2 men who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out a loan of 120000 YER from AMB.

Hanan, 30, is married with one child. She owns a small house and works hard to provide a good life for her child. She applied for a youth loan of 30000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to enroll her child in private school.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a 59-year-old married woman with 11 children. She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Eseta has requested a loan to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, and bush knives and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Eseta will spend her profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, bush knives, and vegetable seeds to start a taro and banana farm.

loans.name: Edmun

texts.en:
This is Edmun. He previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories, and to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for his repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Edmun hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level and dreams to have their own house. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Gloria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
This is Exaltacion, She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Exaltacion dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials, like fabric and thread, for her business.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a 52-year-old farmer who lives in Kitale county in Kenya with his wife and six school-age children. He has been in farming for the last seven years, producing milk and eggs which he sells at the local market.

Josephat is requesting a 31,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He will sell the milk and improve his family's income, which will enable him to educate his children. He plans to have four dairy cows and become the main milk supplier at the local market in his area in the next five years.

Pests and diseases are the major challenges that he faces in his farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 36 years old and married. He supports a family of two. He is a horticultural farmer and has been in this business for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of 50,000 KES. 

He is servicing his second loan of 80,000 KES from KADET LTD. This will facilitate his preparation of the farm and allow him to purchase more agricultural supplies.

He hopes to use his anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams are to improve his family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship with her husband, and has six children. She and her family reside in a rural community in the town of Msambweni, Coast Province.

Mishi has been selling food products and groceries for more than five years. She sells basic grains, soft drinks, hygiene and cleaning products, flour, and snack foods. 

At the moment, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES so that she can purchase detergents, flour, dairy products, sugar, toilet paper, and soft drinks. She says that if her business is well-stocked, she will gain more customers and increase her earnings. Her goal is to expand her shop and offer more products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy detergent, flour, dairy products, sugar, toilet paper, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Genaro is a 44-year-old married man and a father of three children from Albur, Bohol. He is engaged in the kalamay-making business. Kalamay is a sweet and sticky delicacy that is known in the country, especially in the area of Bohol. It is made of ground glutinous rice and coconut milk.

Genaro is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for making kalamay, such as glutinous rice, coconut, sugar and peanuts. With this, he will be able to make more kalamay to sell in the market, thus increasing his sales and profits.

In the future, Genaro aims to expand his business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making kalamay, such as glutinous rice, coconut, sugar and peanuts.

loans.name: Kyaitamba Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a member of the group in which each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. He is a 27-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He operates a retail shop and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and increase his stock. He faces the hardships of price fluctuation and bad debtors, whereas his vision is to have a wholesale shop. Stephen is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and soap to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used blankets and comforters for resale

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en: Sifaga is a 56-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells ice cakes (frozen snacks) in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Sifaga needs a loan to buy a sack of sugar, foam cups, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Sifaga has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sugar and foam cups to make frozen snacks.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
This is Lerma, 36, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, an employee, and is a mother to her children. Lerma operates a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php20,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lerma hopes to give her children a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. *A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners and meet weekly to study, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas, firewood and soft broom to resell

loans.name: Konga

texts.en:
Konga is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of six and fifteen. All of them go to school.

Konga runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 Ssp to purchase sugar, cooking oil and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Konga would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Konga says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of kiva .

loans.use: to purchase more  items like sugar,cooking oil, rice etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de un año, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Olinda no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Olinda se dedica a la agricultura, ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno que donde siembra maíz, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sus labores de campo, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por el cuidado y dedicación que tiene con su cultivo.
Olinda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra del abono que necesita su cultivo, de esta manera ella espera poder obtener una buena cosecha de su cultivo de maíz, el cual espera poder vender a un buen precio y con dicha ganancia ella espera poder poco a poco lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 20 year old woman who lives in the city of Nazca with her life partner and her one year old son.  She loves them, and they are her main reason for living.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic woman.  She and her life partner devote all of their efforts to getting their family ahead.

Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work to pay their expenses, Olinda was not able to study for a professional career.  However, she would very much have liked to do so.  In her free time she likes to watch educational programs on the television.  Sometimes she makes the delicious ‘Frejoles con Seco’ [marinated meat with beans] to share with her family.

Olinda farms with great effort and dedication.  She has a small piece of land where she grows corn.  She starts her work in the field in the early hours of the morning every day.  She can work approximately eight hours.  She believes it is going well for her because the care and dedication she gives her crops.

Olinda is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to her she will be able to buy the fertilizer her crop needs.  That way she hopes to be able to get a good harvest from her corn crop.  She hopes to be able to sell said harvest for a good price.  With this income she hopes to be able to, little by little, fulfill her big dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a man of thirty-seven years, married to Jackline and the father of three children. He is a tailor and he has been in this business for fourteen years now and gets a monthly income of forty-thousand shillings.
 
This will be Dickson’s first loan from KADET Ltd. and he plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for making clothes. In future, he wants to be a successful business man.

loans.use: to add more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Montoya

texts.en: Topoika, a 44-year-old married father of six children, has been a maize and wheat farmer for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 32,000. Now requesting his third loan of KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD to help prepare the farm and purchase inputs, Topoika hopes to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in and expand his farm. His dream is to improve the family's living standard and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Kahangi United Group

texts.en: Stellah is a 38-year-old married woman with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop, and in addition to that, she is practicing crop production as a side business. Her challenges include inadequate capital to meet the demand, price fluctuations and high transport costs. However, despite these problems, she dreams of educating her children up to the university and modernizing her agricultural practices. Stellah intends to use the loan to buy  sugar, salt and maize flour to sell. She is a member of the above mentioned group, in which each person guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a resident of the town of Msambweni. She is 56 years old, widowed and has six children.

Mwanajuma is involved in buying and selling coconuts. In addition, she also sells paraffin. Both businesses are home-based. She has been involved in sales for two years.
 
Mwanajuma is requesting this loan to purchase more stock of coconuts for sale. Her goal is to buy a handcart and hire an employee to be supplying coconuts in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita, who is married, works hard to support her family. For the past 30 years she has had a fishing business in the Philippines, and is now requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, Warlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
Azucena, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y sociable. Es conviviente con Enel quien es empleado y es padre de sus 2 hijos a quienes quieren mucho. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compraron con muchos esfuerzos. La actividad que realiza Azucena es el servicio de llenado de horno secadores de madera a las empresas maderas de las zona, son unos hornos metálicos de gran tamaño que usan las empresas procesadoras de maderas para darle una mayor calidad y durabilidad usando el secado a la maderas. Contando con el apoyo de su pareja quien trabaja en una de esas empresas de madera que usa de estos servicios, para lo cual ella llega a emplear la ayuda de hasta 5 personas.
Se inició en éste negocio hace más de 18 meses  con un capital propio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja que le han servido para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Se decidió empezar con éste negocio por idea de su pareja viendo la oportunidad de negocio, decidió apoyarlo para solventar  los gastos del hogar y así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ahora observando los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene planes de incursionar en otro negocio que ha visto ser rentable que es la venta de ropas. Este será el préstamo número 09 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida al saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para continuar con su negocio. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, por el apoyo que vienen dando la personas con negocios.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de víveres para al preparación de comidas para dar pensión para sus trabajadores en las labores de llenado de hornos para secado de madera, así como en el pago de sus jornales.
texts.en:
Azucena, who is 40, is not only a hardworking and committed woman, but is also friendly and sociable.  She lives with Enel, a clerk, who is the father of their 2 children whom they love very much.  They live comfortably together in their own home which they bought through a great deal of hard work.  

Azucena's business involves loading wood-drying kilns for local timber companies.  These huge metal kilns are used by wood processing companies to dry wood, which improves its quality and durability.  With the support of her partner, who works in one of the timber companies which use these services, she manages to employ up to 5 people to help her.  She set up her business more than 18 months ago using her own money and, so far, has run it single-handedly.  She believes that the business is cost-effective because it generates good profits which have enabled her to cover her household expenses.  When her partner, seeing a business opportunity, came up with the idea, she decided to set up the business to help him cover the household expenses and provide a better quality of life for their children.    

Now, due to the good results she is achieving, she has plans to expand into selling clothing, another business which she knows can be profitable.  This will be her 9th loan from the MFP institution.  She is happy in the knowledge that she will have the financial support to continue with her business and is also grateful to her communal bank for the support it offers to people with businesses.  She will use the 2,500 nuevos soles which she is applying for to provide meals for those she employs to load the wood-drying kilns and to pay their wages.

loans.use: to buy food for her workers and pay their wages.

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta is 51 years old and married with six children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dioleta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Dioleta requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials to repair her fishing boat.

Dioleta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Dioleta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  She makes and sells pancakes in her community, which she has been doing for four years. 

Silia is requesting a loan, which she will use to to buy for a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a stove, and other cooking tools for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.  She plans to use her profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, yeast,  and a stove.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 37 years old and married. She has one child. 

She owns and operates a business venture. She makes elei (printed fabric) clothes and lavalava (traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt by men and women). She has four years of experience in this line of business. 

Jacinta needs a loan to to buy traditional designs, colour paints and fabric. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and to help improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy traditional designs, colour paint, fabric and paint brushes.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 44 years old and a single mother of two children. She has rental houses, which she has had for 11 years. Besides this, she also sells porridge in the Dallas Kangemi area. 

Pauline plans to use the entire loan to repair the rental houses she owns. With the returns from her business, she wants to expand the business and pay school fees for her children. 

In future she wants to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To repair her rental houses.
